Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant and Bed”
Reviews.Author: SDGWH
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying in this hotel. The room is big, neat and the bed is very comfortable. However, I can see some sign of aging from the furniture. Anyways, it's still of first class quality for the money. A nice surprise is that they got room service checking if I need anything, like some more complimentary water. I had breakfast at their restaurant the other morning. It was a full buffet offering both Hong Kong style and western food. A wide range of beverage from several kinds of juice, Chinese tea, coffee and western tea are all available. Very nice experience after all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent yet again”
Reviews.Author: GriffinFamily4
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel and still very good, had a Club Room which includes breakfast and cocktail evening. Rooms well appointed and service excellent. Food quality very good and close to University MTR stationed easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Much better this time”
Reviews.Author: SamTheCalifornian
Reviews.Content: Back to the same hotel again. Second time at the hotel and better experience this time. Did not try the breakfast but buffet lunch is good. Although juice is extra! Food selection is good. Room and service are still good. Hotel is still well kept.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to B”
Reviews.Author: IndranilChakraborty
Reviews.Content: Visited Hong Kong as a first part of a Hong Kong & Macau conducted tour. The hotel was only the beginning of a great touring experience. The room was good, the view out of it was excellent. Had a great time both beside the pool and in it. Very well connected, for a person who knew little about Hong Kong, having the city train service just beside the hotel was great. The breakfast had a nice spread, me being a non vegetarian faced no issues, some of my friends being vegetarians even didn't find a reason to complain. We toured Hong Kong extensively, from Disney Land to the bargain markets, and for two days of trying fun, Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Sha Tin was definitely a the best place to end your day.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Peking Duck”
Reviews.Author: CalDorset
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel specially to try the Peking duck. A local Chinese foody friend recommended it, and I must say that I was totally impressed. Having lived in Hong Kong for 12 years and travelled frequently to Beijing, I can honestly say that this was the best Peking duck that I have ever tasted - it was pure heaven. The crab soup dumplings were also quite delicious. One normally expects the Hyatt Regency to be slightly inferior to the Grand Hyatt, but this hotel was superb

Reviews.Title: “My most pleasant stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Sherry B
Reviews.Content: It is one of my favourite hotel. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I have stayed there for 2 times. Although it is not located in city centre, shuttle bus is available to Shatin Town Centre and Tsim Sha Tsui. I also highly recommend Sha Tin 18. After you try the suckling Peking Duck, it just melts in your mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: DLight_11
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family took advantage of using some well-earned Hyatt Gold passport points to have a little break in our home hometown for 2 nights recently. We had already heard very good reports regarding the Sunday brunch buffet so we arrived early and rang ahead to reserve a table for lunch. Upon arrival we were taken immediately to the club lounge for check-in and our room was already available. The rooms are spacious and bright and we had a small sofa at the end of the bed which was replaced with a roll-away childs bed. Even with that set-up, there was still plenty of space in the room for the 4 of us. The Sunday lunch at the Cafe was fabulous, with a wide variety of delicious appetisers, mains and desserts. Having use of the club lounge (with its own outdoor sky terrace) was great, especially for the evening cocktails and canapés where the friendly staff serve a wide selections of drinks and nibbles and the atmosphere is child friendly. The hotel boasts a large outdoor pool with a bar area, a fully equipped fitness centre and a spa. As a frequent business traveler, I do utilise Hyatt hotels and I'd say this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable time for 2 families”
Reviews.Author: Anatomywoo
Reviews.Content: 1D2N for 2 families Check-in: Due to time delay, our two families checked in separately about an hour apart and was placed in different floors. The duty manager, Mr Sung, provided excellent service, and offered to arranged our two families on the same floor. it would be best if this was done right in the beginning, saves the trouble for both families and we could spend more time enjoying the facilities of the hotel. Room / Suite: tidy and clean. The suite offered a memorable view - day and night. We just don't feel like leaving our rooms Swimming pool: clean and spacious. pool side bar offered good choice of drinks Breakfast: food quality was generally good but increase in variety to match with price is suggested Conclusion: a hotel that my family and i would love to come back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PA88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six days and can attest that this is an excellent hotel. I have experienced other high-end hotels in Hong Kong and this one was equivalent in décor, comfort and services. The hotel was in like-new condition. With blonde woods and large windows, the rooms were very bright and airy. The small surcharge for a harbor view was well worth it. This was especially true in the hot summer because the sun rises over the harbor, leaving the room cooler in the late afternoon. Before arriving at the hotel I didn’t like concept of a glass wall between the bathroom and the bedroom but ended up appreciating it for making the bathroom bright and open – not the usual cave. Service was usually good and the staff seemed sincerely considerate. I was told that this hotel is a teaching site for the adjacent University which would explain both the earnest young staff and the occasional minor errors. When calling the service line, most times it was answered immediately (unlike many hotels where it rings and rings). The food, both restaurant and room service, was quite good. The buffets had enormous variety including sushi station, roast meats carving station, pasta station, dim sum selection and dessert station where they made crepes or sundaes to your order. In contrast to other hotels, the same meal cost about 10% less for room service than in the restaurant (both had a 10% service charge). My local relatives mentioned that the restaurant has a reputation for quality. The main downside to the hotel was that its location was inconvenient getting to Central or TST. The MTR East Rail line station was right next to the hotel but it took at least 2 transfers to get to Central and maybe 30-40 minutes depending on the time of day. Taxi to Kowloon station was HKD135 and probably HKD200 to Central. Aside from the MTR station and a new building for the Chinese University Business School, there were no shops or anything else in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. On the other hand, the room rates were significantly cheaper and the charges for meals and laundry were about 25% less than the centrally-located hotels. (Shirts and slacks were impeccably done by their laundry service but it always arrived about a half hour after the promised 6pm delivery deadline.) The hotel has good promotions – I was upgraded to a huge one bedroom, 1.5 bath suite for the price of a normal room. The suite had 6 telephones, a small refrigerator, microwave and dishes, cups and glasses (no stove). Some other details: At the airport, get in the line for a green taxi as the hotel is in the New Territories. It cost HKD260 (would be somewhat more with guests and luggage) and took about 30 minutes. Breakfast buffet was HKD228 and dinner buffet was HKD428 (468 on weekends), plus 10% service. They didn’t have a good selection of vegetarian items, particularly on the menu, but the hotel said they would look into adding more. My suite had a Nespresso machine with 4 regular pods and 2 decaff pods. Two bottles of water were provided. The water and coffee were free and replenished daily. The in-room safe was large – a large laptop would fit along with papers and accessories. There was a charge for broadband wired internet – I paid HKD550 for a week’s access. The internet worked well and was never out, even during a level 10 typhoon. Local calls were HKD6. The bathroom had the usual shaver electric outlet that was intended to fit both U.S. 2-prong flat blades and Euro 2-prong round plugs – the U.S. plug didn’t fit so I used a Euro 2-prong adapter. The other outlets in the room were for the big U.K. 3-prong plugs. One adapter was provided on the desk so I could plug in my U.S. laptop. Room configurations varied so if you don't like the room you get, check the floor diagram on the back of your door and ask for another.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripAmm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin for 2 weeks June 23-July 7. Our family of 4 had connecting rooms - 1 king and the other, 2 twins. The rooms are wonderfully appointed, as expected for a Hyatt Regency. We had a wonderful stay - the staff is so courteous, sincere, and kind, treating all their guests the same no matter where you are from. We are Chinese Americans and this was especially appreciated. It was also our first visit to HK not staying at either Tsim Sha Tsui or HK Island and we were nervous about the location being too far away. However, the train was so close and convenient (as well as the hotel shuttle) that this was completely fine. We ate at the hotel, Sha Tin 18, and even the little cafe (our favorite each morning!) and were never disappointed. If I had to say any negatives, the drainage in both the showers were slow, but we didn't report this because it didn't bother us enough to. I think if we did it would've been fixed. At the pool it seems you can smell the exhaust from the restaurant. We didn't use the pool much, though so that was ok too.

Reviews.Title: “Directly at the Metro Station "University"”
Reviews.Author: TeHaumi
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Sha Tin HKG Positive: True 5 Star hotel in an excellent location near the Chinese University. The Regency Club facilities on the 25th floor are worth booking. The complimentary evening cocktail includes unlimited good wine. The staff are extremely helpful. Bicycles can be hired, and cycle tracks are nearby. Negative: There is quite a bit of smog in Hong Kong, but much more in the centre than at Sha Tin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not central”
Reviews.Author: Amberleighboo
Reviews.Content: My husband is based at this hotel for 8 months for work so it wasn't a personal choice to stay there and I personally wouldn't choose the location. Nice modern hotel, as would be expected from a Hyatt. It is a very short walk from the mtr (university station) so getting into town is not a huge effort, takes about 25 mins but you go have to change lines. Pool bar food is lovely, club sandwich and the squid are both worth eating, didn't eat anything else in the hotel as we ate in town or cooked ourselves as my husbands appt has a small kitchenette. Supermarket is nearby in shatin which is 2 stops south on the mtr, this shopping ctr also has loads of other shops. I didn't go north. Big negative was lack of anything around the hotel that didn't involve public transport, there is a small 7/11 at the mtr station so other than basic snacks it was a bit of a job to have to pop out for anything. The 0pool bar staff were amazing in particular a really nice lady who's name I can't remember. One of the bar managers really went out if his way for us one night too. prices for drinks and food is as would be expected, High, even more than many of the central hotels we went to for drinks which I guess is down To lack of competition locally. Room (1 bed appt) is big and fairly well stocked for short stay, not really so well stocked for long stay, the kitchen lacked thought and with the long stay equipment added ie microwave and hot plate it left literally no room at all to prepare or serve food up onto plates sobyou end up with half the prep in the lounge, and kitchen equipment plugged in at various places around the lounge. The pool area is lovely, the gym great, always fairly quiet, gym showers/changing area, perfect and relaxing, Overall I would stay at this hotel again if it were better located or made up for the location in service and price which I don't feel it does.

Reviews.Title: “Love It”
Reviews.Author: FJDaiker
Reviews.Content: its an awesome property of Hyatt outside of downtown Hongkong. me and my wife love this property. quite secluded, not so many people around and its good for those who wants to have an intimacy with their spouse. i get the beautiful harbour view and large window facing the sea, where me and my wife get the wake up call from the beautiful sun shine. everything in the room is very nice and comfy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GriffinFamily4
Reviews.Content: Nice, good quality hotel, big rooms, facilities ideal for business and pleasure. MTR station close so easy access to all Hong Kong. Food good quality and great service. 30 mimute drive from airport, approx $40 usd for taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Shatin, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Stephenchau
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty good, only few minutes from Shatin MTR station where you don't have to worry about shopping, dining, entertainment and transportation. Also, the hotel is 20 minutes away from Tsim Sha Tsui, you may catch up some business, luxury shopping and there is a landmark of the Kowloon side. Harbour view of rooms are fabulous, you may stay inside the room to watch this wonderful picture from your window The hotel room setting is very trendy, very comfortable and very clean, we stayed inside the room for the whole day. We celebrated our anniversary and my birthday, there is very good hotel I always recommend. You cannot bargain with a local for the best hotel with best value, we always stay out for special days and celebrations. Shatin 18 Restaurant is a place you should try, Guang Dong dim sum are very good there and of course you should try their Peking Duck. The Peking Duck is very famous there, 3 courses for Peking Duck is my recommendation that you will have duck skin, duck skin pancake and duck soup, they all are yummy. Definitely, you will enjoy a nice meal from the Shatin 18 Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “5-star hotel with some small maintenance issues.”
Reviews.Author: HJB93
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Sha Tin district in the New Territories of Hong Kong. The hotel is situated close to the Tolo Highway and offers views over the Tolo Harbour. The taxi-drive (between HK$220 - $HK270; I forgot the exact fare...) from the airport took between 25 and 35 minutes. Be sure to take a green taxi since only those taxi's drive to the New Territories. A MTR station is located directly next to the hotel, it is called "University" and is part of the East Rail Line (light blue). So It is also possible to reach the hotel by MTR but I would not recommend that since you have to interchange a few times to get on the right line and the particular line is quite busy. I would recommend to buy an Octopus Card which is useable at all forms of public transport throughout Hong Kong, another advantage of the card is that you can pay with it at a lot of stores, such as 7Eleven, Cirkle K, Starbucks, etc. Since the MTR station is located next to the hotel, getting to the Hong Kong city centre is quite easy, but takes some time. To, for example, reach the "Tsim Sha Tsui" station, you have to interchange twice. First you take the East Rail Line (light blue) to "Kowloon Tong" there you interchange on the Kwun Tong Line (bright green) and interchange once more at the "Prince Edward" station to the Tsuen Wan Line (red). Reaching this station will take around 20 minutes. In the other way the MTR extends all the way to the connection with the Shenzen MTR, so that's quite nice if you want to visit Shenzen. Just two stops from the "University" station, at the "Sha Tin" station, is a shopping mall which is called New Town Plaza. It offers a wide range of shops and restaurants and is spread over multiple wings. In New Town Plaza I it is usually quite busy, for more peace go to New Town Plaza III, there are also more restaurants :). We wanted to know in advance what the cancellation policy was if you book at the Hyatt website itself since that was not clearly stated. We also wanted to know if we would be charged for an extra bed if we booked through Hyatt itself. So I sent an e-mail to the hotel and I friendly got answer. Cancellation policy is the first night + 10% if you cancel after 2:00 pm the day before arrival. Since I got no answer about the extra bed, we booked the first night through Agoda and would ask at the hotel itself and then further extend our stay with two more nights. Upon arrival at the hotel the bellboy will take your luggage and assist you to check-in. Upon our arrival there was no available employee at the front desk. Instead of waiting there immediately came an employee who checked us in. We booked for one night the day before arrival by Agoda, and should book the second and third night after arrival. When we checked in, the employee could not find our reservation so he had to check with the Agoda website. He politely asked us if we would take place in the lobby and resume check in after he checked with Agoda and made a new reservation for the second and third night after we mentioned that we would like to stay three nights, these were booked through Hyatt itself and the rate was more or less the same as through Agoda. It took about 10 minutes before he had sorted it out. Nevertheless, check-in was very convenient. One minor drawback was that after check-in we heared the roomnumber but nobody directed us to our room, we were supposed to search it ourselfs, we did not even know on which floor we were situated (although that was easy to deduct from the room number). The bellboy brought the luggage after we entered the room. The staff upon arrival and check-in were very kind, polite and helpful. The lobby area is small but cosy with a few seats and direct access to the restaurant for breakfast and dinner (don't know if they also serve lunch, probably it is all day dining). There are some shops at your lefthand side and the concierge is located at your righthand side. At the concierge you can get some free maps of Hong Kong and they are quite helpful when you have questions about certain services. Opposite from the concierge there are some mirrors at the wall on which you can leave a message and on which the weather forecast for the particular day is drawn. Very nice. Elevators can only be operated to go up when in posses of a valid key card for a room, that is a quite nice security feature :). We booked a Mountain View Twin room with extra bed. I don't know which rooms are Mountain View and which are Harbour View but we looked over water with mountains in the back instead of just mountains. I actually enjoyed this view more than if we got a room with just mountain view. The room was 38 square meter and had modern and contemperory furniture. The beds for example were kinda floating above the floor. An power adapter was already available in the room. The beds were good and quite soft with good and firm pillows. The room features airconditioning which is slightly personalisable, but not so much, it's just okay :). There is a range of magazines available in your room and a LCD TV is also present with quite a lot channels. There is also a glass desk and a cable which can be used to connect to the internet, there is also wireless internet available in each room. The internet is very expensive in this hotel, one hour internet costs HK$80, a day pass costs HK$150. I think internet should be complementary. There were some little maintenance issues in the room, for example near the desk the wall was damaged. There was also a gap in the linen of the extra bed, this may not happen. This needs to be fixed but probably is not seen by maintenance staff. There was also a booklet with all the information and services about the hotel, but this was ripped...quite strange that this was not replaced. The minibar was empty, but that was okay, so we could use it for our own stuff. When some people were in the corridor at night and they were talking, we could quite clearly hear them, not so plesant if you want to sleep. Housekeeping did not refill the complementary coffee and tea, so we had to ask for it one night. Housekeeping also did not switch our linen even though we did put the "Change my linen"-card on the bed. The bathroom was quite big and featured a sink with mirror and all standard amenities as well as a bathtub, separate toilet and separate rainshower. I really like the rainshower! Our toilet featured a quite strong urine odour, don't know where it came from but it was persistent most of the time. The door rubber on the door to the shower was also ripped/broken/weak. Had the impression that housekeeping does not clean the (bathroom)floors every day since during our complete stay some hairs were on the floor, quite dirty; I did not expect this from a five star hotel. The hotel also has a pool, it is located on level M, just as the fitness room and business centre. Actually, you have to go by elevator to level M, then change in the changingrooms, walk through the fitness room and go down by elevator to the lobby level (separate elevator that only runs between M and L), the pool is located outside at the backside of the hotel and offers a nice view on the mountains. We did not try the pool since the pool was closed on the evening we wanted to take a dive due to thunderstorms. Check out was also rather quick and there were plenty of taxi's to the airport which can be arranged through the hotel (just normal taxi's). So to wrap up: this hotel is very good but all the small maintenance problems lead to a lower rating than I did expect since it is a five star hotel. If they solve the problems, then it's a truly five star hotel with a beautiful location just out of the busy city but also quite close to the city centre. I would surely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and customer service :)”
Reviews.Author: Arryan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 peaceful and well rested nights. I agree its slightly away from the city life. By MTR its about 35 minutes to Hong Kong Central and requires 2 interchanges also. By cab, it should be around/less than 200 HKD to Central including toll charges. Didn't try that one but its an approximate figure. First of all, let me comment about the customer service I received for the hotel booking. I was booking the room through Hyatt website but at payment confirmation page, my card was not getting accepted because the booking system accepts cards with maximum expiry year of 2019 only. Hence online booking was not possible for me. I called the reservation on phone and they in turn connected me to central reservation desk where the person proceeded to collect my card details and informed kindly that I do not need to make a prepayment until I arrive at the hotel even though the room I was booking was on "Advance Purchase - Full prepayment" offer only. Well, I was very much impressed by this gesture. And a note to those who read this - "Hyatt Sha Tin has one of the cheapest rates for a 5 star hotel in Hong Kong". Upon arrival at the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised to get a room upgrade to Harbour View King and the check in process hardly took around 10 minutes. The room was well furnished and the views were amazing. The best part of the room was that, I could soak myself in the bath tub and watch the TV in the bedroom without twisting my head in any awkward angle. The whole stay was very very comfortable. We did have dinner at the Cafe and the buffet spread was excellent. The desserts were excellent. Especially the pan cakes. Don't miss that one. You can choose what all toppings to go into it. The Cafe Manager was always ensuring that all guests get what they want and he personally came to our table along with few more assistants and sang Happy Anniversary / Birthday for us and made us cut a small cake as well. Overall, we were extremely happy with our stay and totally felt like being at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fabulous views of the mountains and waterfall.”
Reviews.Author: BirthdayGirlNov
Reviews.Content: We brought our son to HK to celebrate his 4 yr old b'day. We chose to stay at Hyatt, Shatin mainly because of its Kids Club. Booked for 3 consecutive nights (Hyatt's website) and we were given an upgrade to a 1 bdrm executive deluxe. We loved the bedroom so much that we didn't want to go anywhere else. It's large and has the view of the mountains, waterfall and the constant MTR plying in front of us (minus the noise). We only left the hotel twice for an early lunch and some shopping at Shatin shopping center (2 MTR stops away). The rest of the time we spent in the room watching free in-house movies. Our stay was made extra special when my son was given a complimentary birthday cake (large chunks of fruits) which was so yummy!

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay!”
Reviews.Author: Devilish_24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights, we wanted a quiet, tucked away location that was still easy to do some sightseeing from. Our room was everything we had expected of an esteemed hotel, lovely bed, big tub and great shower. The front desk staff was very proffesional and helpful during our entire stay. We had the barbeque buffet on our first night and it certainly did not disappoint, fresh and perfectly prepared meat and fish made to order, followed by a lovely dessert selection. Ordered from the menu for every other meal and every dish was great. Tin Tin Bar for happy hour each night was a delight.... enjoyed the cocktails and entertainment (vocalist and pianist) very much. All in all a lovely stay, would recommend to anyone who wishes to have a nice break away from the husle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very affordable in the real HK”
Reviews.Author: RhysManchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when visiting local relatives, just one stop on the metro to the main area.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neeta52
Reviews.Content: This is a little way out of the cente of Kowloon but a lovely fresh greeen alternative to the concrette and traffic. The service at the hotel is superb and the food is excellent. There is a super pattiserie pastry shop in the lobby which is a perfect alternative if you arrive back too late. I have stayed there 5 times now and all fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Lives upto its name”
Reviews.Author: Monalisa777
Reviews.Content: Superb Business hotel with MTR very close by. Very good conferencing and hotel facilities. Speedy check in-check out with efficient staff. Very big and spacious rooms and bathrooms compared to hongkong hotel standards. Pleasant mountain view rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great service and hotel”
Reviews.Author: welovehongkong27
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed for two nights. As we were traveling with children we were upgraded to a huge deluxe room - lovely. Breakfast was good - lots of choice but a little noisy. We had the buffet in the evening which is expensive but there was a wide variety and high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Another side of HK”
Reviews.Author: jamesc23
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a great Hyatt. It's literally right next to University MTR (five minutes to a huge mall at Sha Tin) and has great views of Tolo Harbour, especially from the Regency Club. Other good points: - The buffet dinner at Cafe is excellent, though the price is a little steep at weekends (over 400HKD). - Service throughout the hotel is excellent, and especially in the club. - Happy hour (two for one) at the bar each night from 5-8pm. - Excellent selection of drinks and snacks in the club. - Serene location away from the neon bustle of Kowloon and HK Island. Some negatives: - I'm a platinum member, and used some points to upgrade to a suite. When I arrived in my room there were no welcome amenities - no fruit, biscuits, nothing. - I found several hairs on the bathroom floor. - The hotel is a long way from the centre. This will really bother some people. - The men's changing room in the fitness centre is very small. Also, the showers face each other and have glass doors so don't expect much privacy! - Why no indoor pool?

Reviews.Title: “Located a little off, but worth the stay.”
Reviews.Author: YongT
Reviews.Content: Located beside a uni in Sha Tin, right next to MTR! Huge sized rooms, clean and new. Beatiful views, reasonablely price is another plus. Hicup that the check in was a crawl. BTW, there is also a very tiny 7-11 convenience store within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent View!Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: CezCLee
Reviews.Content: We just came from our 2 nights stay in Macau and we went to Hongkong for an R n R after losing some RMB. Frankly, Hyatt Sha Tin is really out of the way from major shopping centers and even from the HKIA. It is more part of a university campus because the universtiies are nearby like outside the front door. Nevertheless,as what I said if you simply want to relax and take a break from the hustle and bustle of the metro downtown just stay in this wonderful place. New hotel at sensible in hotel rate. Truly Hyatt in service and quality. We got the Harbour view in their club floors. We enjoyed the cocktail plus the magnificent view of Sha Tin Harbour while drinking wine.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good Hyatt with pretty reasonable rates, slightly away from the centre”
Reviews.Author: Babemoon
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience the first time I stayed and that's why I decided to stay again, 3 weeks apart. The front desk staffs are friendly and professional. Thumbs up to them for trying their best to accommodate requests however the concierge or bell service may need to be worked on a tad bit more. Twice I arrived by taxi right to the front door with luggage and neither was helped until I pushed my own luggage(s) into the lobby only to be asked "do you need help"? The room I was given this time however was much left to be desired. First the door lock was faulty. The door can be opened without the key card! I hadn't noticed it initially and was going in and out of the room assuming that the door will automatically lock behind you. It was promptly fixed though. Bathroom fixtures aren't functioning too well either. Water from the toilet continues to flow after a flush, the wash basin's drain plug wasn't working well either. Overall I would still recommend this hotel although it's a little away from the city centre, the KCR railway stop is just 50 meters from the hotel and Hong Kong public transportation system has excellent connectivity to almost everywhere. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus service from Kowloon station on the Airport Express line as taxis from the airport to the hotel can costs from HKD250-300. I will go back to this hotel as I like to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Rooms are big to Hong Kong standards. Variety and quality of the food is good too. I hope they won't give me another faulty room this time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent value for money - Regency club sucks”
Reviews.Author: NTalan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 9 nights and the stay was quite comfortable. The location is slightly out of main area but is excellent value for money as the hotel is next to University MTR station. The connectivity is good and station is just a minute walk I stayed in a suite and the rooms were good and welll maintained. My only problem was with the Regency Club. Being in a suite i had access to Regency Club. I always thought that the Regency Club of Hyatt was a priviledge but actually it turned out to be a "Restricted Economy". I was told rudely that i could take breakfast only on the club floor and not in the cafe. If it is a privildge why do you have restrictions?

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, out of the way location”
Reviews.Author: DiamondGP80
Reviews.Content: I was passing through Hong Kong and had a short one-night-stay at this property. I had actually wanted to stay at the other Hyatt Regency, the one in Tsim Sha Tsui due to its excellent location, but the rate was prohibitively expensive that I thought it really wasn't worth it for a 20-hour stay where I didn't really need to go anywhere. This was my 6th stay at this property so I was somewhat familiar with the hotel. I took a cab from/to the airport and it was around HKD300 each way and the journey took about 30 minutes. Upon arrival, the front desk staff escorted me to the Regency Club lounge for check-in. Being a Diamond member, I was always upgraded to a bigger Club room although never to a room with a Harbor view. Unusually, the hotel has many different kinds of room layouts and if I remember correctly, I've been in about 5 different kind of rooms. The staff in the lounge was polite and some were friendlier than others. Service during happy hour was just ok though, the staff didn't clear the table often and never proactively offered to top up drinks or bring more hot food, etc. The happy hour was from 5-8 pm, which I thought was pretty generous, and the spread was quite good and there were a couple of hot items you could order off a menu. The service during breakfast was much much better with friendly and attentive staff who couldn't do enough. There was an egg dish that was made to order and also at least 3 types of congee. The lounge itself is fairly big, with great views of the Tolo Harbor and also a semi-outdoor terrace. The hotel provides free shuttle bus services to and from Shatin town and Tsim Sha Tsui at regular intervals. Although the bus tends to be packed quite quickly, so it pays to be at the bus stop early. Otherwise, TST is about 30 minutes by MTR and the Chinese border at Lo Wu is also about 20 minutes by train. They also used to have a direct bus service from the airport to the hotel and vice versa, so the hotel was really convenient for short transit stays when I didn't need to go to the city. Unfortunately, they had since discontinued this service, so the hotel became less attractive to me. But overall, this is a good value hotel, if you don't mind the extra commute time. Overall, it was a good stay. Most likely I wouldn't have stayed there if I needed to be in the city as the location was really out of the way, but for this stay where I really didn't need to go anywhere it was just perfect. After adding the cab fare from/to the airport, the overall price I paid was still less than half of what I would've had to pay had I stayed at the HR TST.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to decide!”
Reviews.Author: masifk
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Sha Tin is located outside the city, its at least 20 mins away from Hong Kong. But at the same time it is very accessible as it is right next to the metro & bus station. You can take a bus, or a cab, or take the more convenient metro to the city. There is even a free shuttle to the other Hyatt located in the shopping district of Tsim Sha Tsui in downtown Hong Kong. The hotel itself is well built, modern & sophisticated. It seemed almost new when I stayed there so I dont know how old it is, but everything was very modern, well kept & clean. The rooms are large, very well made & up to the Hyatt standards. The food is good as well, & I dont know if it seemed reasonably priced to me because of the value of the Hong Kong Dollar or because it was actually cheap compared to other hotels? You be the judge & try it out yourself. Great hotel, great stay, but...is it worth staying so far away from the city? Is it worth spending up to 30 mins on the metro to reach any of the sights & attractions? I guess it depends on how much money you are willing to spend on a hotel. The hotels in the city are not cheap, & compared to the Hyatt Sha Tin are a lot more expensive even if its a three or four star hotel. So it pretty much depends on how you want to spend your money I guess. Spend less on a hotel & more time commuting to & from the city sights & attractions, or spend more on a hotel & no time commuting by staying in the city. There is a Hyatt right in the city centre, a lot more expensive though. You decide.

Reviews.Title: “Great HK hotel a little outside the busy city”
Reviews.Author: dwypler
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern. Amazing pool. Free shuttle service to TST & airport express. About 20-30min cab or free shuttle ride to downtown HK. Right next to the metro station. Restaurant a little pricey for being outside the city.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: xinli29288
Reviews.Content: Located just next to University Station between the railway line connecting Shenzhen and Hong Kong, Hyatt Regency Sha Tin sees quite a huge number of Mainland tourists. The hotel is also located at Tolo Harbour, a rather scenic place and the hotel even provides bicycles for rent to cycle along the harbour. Our stay at the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin did not start off smoothly as the bellhop was arrogant and snobbish and the checking in took at least 45 minutes, at one moment, one receptionist processed the checking in then left us waiting until another receptionist took over and redo the check in. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. There is one problem though: the bathroom door lock was not working. The service at the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin was inconsistent, the people working at the gym were very friendly and helpful and the Front Desk Manager was courteous too. However, the staf at the cafe and the entrance were one of the worst I have experienced in my travels. Included in our package was an afternoon tea and breakfast. Both of which were unimpressive but there was decent variety of food. The teriyaki yakitori served during afternoon tea for example tasted like packaged food heat up in a microwave and the scrambled eggs for breakfast was overdone and tasteless. The bicycles were a nice touch but they seriously need some servicing, some of the brakes are not working and certain parts are rusty. As for other facilties, I enjoyed the gym and outdoor heated-pool. If you can afford the Club Room, the Club Lounge has an amazing view of the Tolo Harbour. The location is not ideal if you plan to explore Central Hong Kong but a good base for exploring the New Territories and perhaps Shenzhen as the railway line can easily bring you there. The hotel's location itself doesn't has much to explore besides the harbour. Overall, the hotel fell way below my expectations for a five star hotel, and the entrance staff being the frontline of the hotel, gave a very poor showing. Nonetheless, Hyatt Regency Sha Tin did responded to my feedback months later with an apology for the poor service and conditions on the bicycle and explained that they charge for the internet because not every guest wants it (hence room rates would be cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “5 star best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Crystalperido
Reviews.Content: A bit off the beaten track but not really an inconvenient location. The University MTR station is a 5 minute walk away and for that you get a hotel which compares very well with the 5 star hotels in downtown at 30-50% less. Prices are a bit higher during the weekend as it is popular with local people as a weekend get-away. Excellent breakfast buffet. The outdoor terrace of the Chinese restaurant with it's views of the natural surroundings offers a unique dining experience. Nice outdoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elguwapo316
Reviews.Content: ...stayed here last December. Great staff! Room service was fast. There's really nothing much to do though. If you're into horse racing - this is the place to stay. What I liked most about this hotel is the very relaxing atmosphere - nothing to do but relax, enjoy the weather and the view!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great price”
Reviews.Author: frypan7
Reviews.Content: Hong kong hotels are expensive over all, This Hyatt in Shatin is only 5 minutes walk from the MTR university station and it is pretty new, and it is about 20-30% less than same class hotel in central area it surrounded by the university and on the back, it is a beautiful lake view Staff is very friendly and room is roomier than other Hong Kong same class hotels

Reviews.Title: “Not As Inconvenience As You Might Think”
Reviews.Author: ASIACOUNTRIES
Reviews.Content: Initially, we thought this hotel would be an inconvenience for anything; inexpensive food, shopping etc, but, as it turns out, it is not as bad as we thought. we booked this hotel without breakfast so we had to get breakfast outside, which is just a short walk from the hotel; just take a lift to the basement and keep walking toward the MTR station (University Station) and around there loads of food and a 7/11 shop where you could also buy your phone card. From this MTR station you are only a couple of stops to Shatin which is THE shopping belt; we lie Shatin a lot there is lots to do with kids, and if it not enough there is the playground in Ikea too but it was only for 20minutes. In Shatin there is a Snoopy World for kids which entrance fees is free when you give its staff a receipt(any amount) from any one of the shopping malls; New Town Phase 1,2,3. Back to the hotel, there are things to entertain the children too; its pool is also very welcoming. In all, we would say this is a hotel offers clean, roomy and inexpensive accommodation. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellochicco
Reviews.Content: Perfect business hotel, very good location and excellent food in a hotel in the New Territorry. You will love the big clean rooms, spacious bathrooms and fitness facilities. Fair price compared to down town Hong Kong hotels. But the breakfast is not included in the room price and is very expensive. The harbor view rooms are the best.

Reviews.Title: “great view, enduring design”
Reviews.Author: justarandomperson
Reviews.Content: the location is a bit far, if your destination is the central/south kowloon area. however, hyatt does provide a complimentary shuttle to/from TST. otherwise, its a 2-transfer on MRT to TST. hotel has a great distant view of the sha tin hoi waters on the east, and immediate proximity to the hills of kau to shan on the west. my room was a regency club king, and was designed with large floor to ceiling panels of wood (birch??). same wood furniture. there is a corner with a work desk that can be enclosed by sliding wood paneling (separate from the primary desk in the room). the whole design is elegant minimalist reminiscent of scandinavian or japanese aesthetics. appreciate the large baths, with private chambers for the toilet and shower (including waterfall showerhead) individually. not much selection for breakfast in the club.

Reviews.Title: “Very good two night stay! And we continue to put up guests at this Hyatt in Sha Tin”
Reviews.Author: BradJill
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Regency for a couple nights and have put guests up here quite a few times since this hotel opened. This has proven to be a very good hotel choice for our guests (and us) for a variety of reasons. First, the quality of the rooms is very good. While being slightly more functional and less luxurious than some of its peers in central HK, the rooms are still very good (new and modern). We really like the large, soft king sized beds that give a great night sleep. The room and bathroom sq. footage is of western standard and we love the large bath tub which has a view to the room television, through the glass bathroom (there is also a sliding screen as well when discretion requires. Views of the mountain and harbor are both good as well. Second, we also like the very competitive price for this Hyatt hotel, which is significantly less due to its location, which interestingly enough is just 20-25 minutes from some of HK's major attractions and just 33 minutes to TST and 38 minutes to Central via MTR, which is a 3 minute walk to the hotel, just next door (University MTR). In particular, we enjoy being able to take our guests to Man Fat Tsz - 10,000 buddha monastery (Sha Tin MTR - 5 minutes), Sha Tin Racecourse (3 minutes by Taxi) and the wonderful Chi Lin Nunnery and Nan Lian Gardens (26 minutes to Diamond Hill MTR). The excellent History of Hong Kong Museum (18 minutes to Hung Hom MTR) and Mong Kok Markets (18 minutes to Mongkok East MTR) also demonstrate how the location of this hotel effects your travel around Hong Kong much less than you might think due to the excellent MTR system we have in HK. What we also like about the Hyatt Regency is the nice outdoor pool, the good gym, ok spa and good dining options. The Cafe at Hyatt has a decent international buffet and serves nice menu dinner items. They offer a American breakfast (HK$220) room service that is large enough for two people and will set up in your room, like a breakfast table. This is great when put up next to your window, overlooking the harbor or mountain. The Sha Tin 18 restaurant, which is a very attractive restaurant, has very good (but pricey) dim sum selection as well as an outdoor patio dining area for those interesting in a nice dinner. There is also a very good hotel lounge bar, called the Tin Tin Bar, which serves standard, reasonably priced drinks, 2 for 1 happy hour, and some nice snacks. Overall, we've been very pleased with this hotel over the past couple years and have stayed here ourselves when wanting an relax in an affordable five star hotel in Hong Kong. Particularly when considering the skyrocketing of hotel room rates in Hong Kong, the Hyatt Regency in Sha Tin is becoming a very good consideration for visitors to HK that are traveling on a budget but still want a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “high quality hotel tucked away in NT”
Reviews.Author: JC2012Albert
Reviews.Content: keeps in line with its brand name of hyatt hotels, the rooms were very clean and elegant. we checked in quite late but still got upgraded to a suite as it was our wedding night and the comfy living room, bathroom and bedroom space was exactly what we needed after a tiring day! very comfy king size bed and pillows the view was pleasant, but don't expect a victoria harbour view even if you book a 'harbour room' - after all, it is NT!!! (the harbour view is of the tolo harbour) the only thing that caught us by surprise was the local land line call charges - they charged us HK$6 per call when we made calls to another local number! had we known that, we would have just used our local cell phones!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Crap Location”
Reviews.Author: ben s
Reviews.Content: Wow. Talk about a great experience. Huge room, super clean, great amenities, the brunch on Saturday morning downstairs was a feast! Nothing bad I can say about this hotel other than it is a bit far away...It is next to University station on the subway that goes between Hung Hom in Kowloon and Shenzhen in China. Remember once you get to Hung Hom you have to change so if you're going to Hong Kong you will need to change twice-once at Hung Hom and again at Admiralty so budget an hour each way. Alternatively take a taxi (100HKD) to Tsing Yi station and take the Airport Express back to Hong Kong for 20HKD.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great place for business trips”
Reviews.Author: S_MorenoSol
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and I spend a considerable amount of time in hotels across the world. I am come to truly value the distinct experience I feel when I stay at Hyatt hotels. Everything you would expect from a Hyatt - you won't be disappointed! I was impressed with the hotel and especially the staff. They were all very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: wadleyfla
Reviews.Content: Staying here was very relaxing and everything was done with excellence. While it is a long, long way from the airport, it is convenient to nearby train station. But, there is not a direct train from the airport. Be prepared for an expensive ride to get there. Once there, however, you will be treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lora18
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place with friendly staff. I was upgraded to a suite and I have no idea why, but it was huge and so clean. Modern and comfortable. The room was a little cold--the a/c definitely works well. Beautiful bathroom. Little bakery downstairs with good snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Everything you can expect from a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: eli_puszkar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and comfortable. The rooms are very convenient and functional with a bathtub and everything else you can expect from a premium hotel. The property is conveniently located approximately 200 yards from the MTR station, which is convenient if you need to move around town. The buffet is great, with Asian and Western style choices that should fit your needs, but the hotel also has a couple more restaurants in case you want something more formal. The Fitness center is Wonderful, with state-of-the-art equipment and a nice and convenient setup. All in all, a great option for any kind of traveller visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The other side of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: annestravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight to celebrate my husbands birthday. The room is very clean, size is big compared to other hotels in hong kong. Staff upon check in was very accomodating thus gave us a good first impression of the hotel. We book a room with breakfast. It was perfect not only for variety but quality as well~ fresh juices, fresh noodles, ham & bacon, cold cuts, pastries, cheeses and more! The hotel also provided a complimentary birthday cake for my husband which is a very nice touch. Location: its far from the hustle bustle of hongkong. recommended for those who want to relax and be out of the city. very near mtr. It was really a good stay, couldn't really find flaws... maybe just hoping that internet is free.. will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: featheast
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is notoriously famous for its pricey high-end five star hotels, for similar hotels located in TST or Central, at least 2000HKD or 300AUD is required. But Hyatt in Shatin offers a really decent price for people to enjoy the five-star luxury while paying only at four-star with a trade-off of relatively far distance from the downtown. But actually it's not a big big drawback given the hotel is only 5 mins walk to University MTR station. Since we are on a transit from Taiwan to mainland of China, we arrived at the hotel from the airport which is quite easy by taking the airport bus A41, which only costs 22.3HKD at the time of writing. The bus will stop at Shatin City Center and another two stops MTR will make you into the hotel lobby in totally less than one hour. And from the hotel to Monkok shopping center is also less than half an hour with convenient public transport. So unless you are having a business trip with meetings in the downtown of HK, for travelling purpose there is no downside of living in Shatin, such a quite a lovely place. The room is quite spacious, clean and every details proves it's five star quality. They have provided almost everything you needed but you might forget such as the elec adaptor. Also there are several latest magazines in the room for people read. The tub is separated with a glass window that you can literally watching TV which taking relax. However, there is no speaker in the bathroom side which is a bit annoying (I did notice that there is a speaker in Sheraton Shanghai but no direct view to the TV).

Reviews.Title: “A Near Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: FinickyBob
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Hong kong on a business trip and stayed at this hotel. Although the place is located in the New Territories, this hotel does deliver the goods. It has got very spacious rooms. In fact, the room we got can accomodate 3 people. The view of the harbour from the room is simply fantastic. The bathroom is spacious as well and the area where the bathtub is has got a glass window which is transparent from the bedroom. The cafe serves probably one of the best breakfasts I have had. The noodle and congee bar alone is worth the trip. Areas for improvement though are the coffee and the service. Coffee should always be served piping hot and service should be impeccable for hotels like this one. If only the Chinese waiters and hotel staff could be trained well in listening and communication skills, then I guess I would have had a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Solid effort”
Reviews.Author: Lankylee
Reviews.Content: Built near university campus as a joint venture; next to tourism school. However, hotel is your regular high end Hyatt Regency effort. Rooms are a very high standard. Only 2 food outlets but both more than adequate. The Shatin 18 tends to be expensive for what it is, serving a mixture of local and somewhat sanitised local stables. A short walk to the local train station.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Riikka P
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room (big separate beds, big bathroom etc) with a good view. The price was nice when compared to tsim sha tsui prices. Gym was nice, a little ballet corner too,. And the swimming pool outside was nice too. Metrostation is like 100 m away and it is near the university. Metro to city centre took just a while. Breakfast was great, although it was quite expensive and not included to price. Staff was more than helpful, great tips for restaurants etc!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the New Territories”
Reviews.Author: kewfriend
Reviews.Content: You would not normally choose to stay over here if it is Hong Kong that you want ... but it is actually a good hotel. Situated above the University MTR station, which means you can get in and out easily, this is a somewhat soulless towerblock. But it houses a decent restaurant and the bedrooms are stunningly capacious. The service is impeccable. Choose a view over the estuary: it is more interesting even if it includes the patrol boat dock and the sewage treatment areas. I had free wifi as part of the business packagae: very sensible considering its cost otherwise and when the server rejected me at 2am there was tech support in the room ten minutes later! This is Hong Kong - things work!

Reviews.Title: “Different view of HK”
Reviews.Author: Ozetrippers
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for all couples, business, families and solo... Hotel has apartments as well. Best view of Tolo Harbour, very close to the MTR, hotel bus down if needed. Found the rooms to be clean and quiet and comfy beds. Will stay here again and now much prefer here to the city. Shopping at Sha Tin "Town Plaza" is massive, ha great food and all the best shops, MTR is in the shopping centre, can't beat that! Great place to stop on the way back from sightseeing. Can hire bike and ride round Tolo harbour, can hire bikes at Sha Tin and ride on a bike path all the way to Ma On Shan along the harbour, best bike ride ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Distant, but very good”
Reviews.Author: MrMoreira
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far from downtown, International Airport, but the hotel is well maintained, staff very friendly and efficient. Whereas it is very cheap taxi in HKG this hotel is an excellent cost benefit. This hotel deserves our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: traveller09092323
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business conference, it was amazing... Had the water front view... Room #1129...amazing... A bit far away from central & tst... But is definitely the best hotel in shatin

Reviews.Title: “Impecable service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liasfave
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4D3N stay in this hotel and was delighted by the warm reception from check in to departure. The long haul from the airport (bus/taxi ride) was compensated by the warm smile and aroma of the reception lobby. Add to it is the ocean air coming from the Tolo harbor. Since our stay is a treat for my baby girl's first birthday, the baby cot was already prepared inside our unit (facing the harbor) plus a birthday cake to our surprise before we check in. Indeed a vacation that is worth remembering. Service is top notch with 24/7 on call assistance for our baby needs. Rate is reasonable compared to the 5 stars in the city. MTR is within reach too. Thumbs up for this hotel. Will definitely stay again on my baby's 2nd bday!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sanjoy88
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent business hotel especially if your work happens to be in the New territories region. While some way from the main action in the HK CBD, conveniently located to the University MTR. Modern and well appointed with an excellent Chinese restaurant in house,

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: AnuSingapore
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is always crowded and is well-known for its tiny rooms, noise and traffic. Hyatt Sha Tin would stand out in this respect. If you want some peace and quiet do go to Hyatt Sha Tin. I had a mountain-view king size bedroom that was at least the size of a 2 bedroom apartment on the 15th floor. Fantastic view to wake up to. The bed was really comfortable and we had a choice of pillows to choose from. Huge room (can't say that enough); sofa set and coffee table made the room service dining experience great. There is a separate bathroom, toilet and bathtub area which is convenient for families travelling together. I had asked for a quiet room as I was a light sleeper and I did not hear any noise from the weddings that took place when I was there. I was there during a public holiday season and there were at least 2 wedding couples that we saw in the hotel during our stay. Contrary to what other reviewers mentioned in this review, there were no loud parties. The service at the hotel is impeccable. We dined in most of the days that we were there and found the breakfast and the dinner to be really good. Nothing was too difficult or unusual. We ended up ordering vegetarian fried rice, which was not on the menu as we loved it so much. Do dine at the Sha Tin restaurant at least once when you are there. The food and the view are amazing. There is a wide range of food (both western and Chinese) in the breakfast buffet and its worth taking a room with breakfast. There is a deli on the ground lobby where you can get pastries and coffee on the go. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that they also offered some spa services to children such as the ‘dainty feet massage’, which was a welcome relief for sore feet tired from walking endlessly in Disneyland. Their Jacuzzi and sauna rooms are spacious and you have attentive staff at hand to help you with your needs. One person you must look out for at Hyatt Sha Tin is Mr Ryan Mok. He is articulate, compassionate and approachable. He is knowledgeable about Disneyland and all the sights we had to see in Hong Kong. I was amazed at his ability to reel off the timings for all the shows and about all the sights around Hong Kong. A perfect concierge if you ask me. I did tease him about not sleeping at all as he was always there when we left the hotel or returned to the hotel. He greeted us by name and definitely knew his job well. He is exceptionally good with children and quickly became my son’s favourite person to look out for. Do look out/ask for him when you need any advice about Hong Kong right down to the best places to dine, place to get medication and to shop. No doubts, he is the face of Hyatt! The hotel is away from the city and Disneyland. Disneyland is about 25-30 mins by taxi. Taxi charges are very reasonable in Hong Kong. The city is about 20 mins away. If you are going to the outlet mall (Citygate) and to see the Big Budda it will also be about 30 mins. Hence you are not as far away from the city as the other reviewers have mentioned. The tram station is barely 3 mins away from the hotel and you can choose to buy a first class ticket (where you will get a seat) to the nearest mall- Sha Tin- which is 2 stations (3 mins) away. The hotel is next to Chinese University of Hong Kong. Hence there are several dining options there as well. Take note that Hong Kong is very crowded on any given day. The sales are great but the crowds are a challenge for anyone travelling with children. Do book your tickets for the cable car to the big Budda online and get the crystal cabin which is less subscribed than the standard cable. But it is always a shorter queue and you get a view of what’s below you too. On the whole, the hotel is by and large expensive but it’s worth every penny! The staff never say ‘no’ (hence I am surprised at another reviewer’s comment about this hotel) and all our requests and special meals were catered to, exceptionally well. Hence, you do get your money’s worth. It’s one of the best Hyatt hotels that I’ve stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A top-notch hotel, albeit far away from Hong Kong center...”
Reviews.Author: Worlds_of_Wonder
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, with top notch service, that has the aura of a resort. Indeed, it has a large pool and tennis courts. The hotel has a mixed crowd: business people, travelers, and numerous wedding parties. The rooms are nice and modern, though there could be more plugs. The restaurant choices are good and the breakfast buffet impressive, but prices are high (albeit not really for Hong Kong). The major downside to the hotel is its location: about 1 hour by subway to Hong Kong Central/Admiralty. And there is little around the hotel other than Chinese University. But this issue depends upon why you are at the hotel. If you are in Hong Kong and looking for a little R & R or a place to hold a family gathering, then this is not a bad option...Like most Hyatt's, this place is not cheap (but again the price did not seem unusual for Hong Kong).

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: KhimLee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for a business trip and really enjoyed the comfort, luxury and convenience of this world-class business hotel. Was on the club floor and room had a great view of the bay. Breakfast was excellent in an exclusive setting. The hotel's proximity to the MTR station is a huge plus, as is the fact that it offers regular shuttle to the downtown area. I would much prefer to stay in Shatin with all the space and serenity it affords than to be holed up in a tiny room amidst the frenzied crowd in the downtown area. The service is excellent and the gym is great with modern equipment. Would definitely stay here again for my next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “addicted to be here for family vacation & sweetheart gathering”
Reviews.Author: audrey-Tam
Reviews.Content: Several stays at Hyatt Shatin and I found that it was a reasonable price hotel which provided you a comfortable environment & service to clients. The swimming pool was great which also consider the kids to play around as well. The jacuzzi provided in the changing room was even better than other Hyatt in Shanghai. About the breakfast buffet was a bit downgrade while compared to 1-2 years before as the variety of food decreased, it may relate to the uprising cost of food. However, the breakfast provided in the lounge floor just the same as it didnt have so many choice to you. The chinese restaurant Shatin 18 still a good place for lunch especially their fusion dessert and personally I loved their noodles and wantons. Personally I addicted to their lounge floor room and services. If you are the CUHK staff and you could enjoy exclusive discount as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel outside the main city of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: levado
Reviews.Content: If you're prepared to stay in a hotel a little outside the hustle and bustle of Kowloon, then the Sha Tin is a good choice. It's located on a hill overlooking the district and is visible from some distance. As the Metro is just next door (the stop is called ''University''), it is conveniently located, and as taxis are not expensive, you can also stay here and get a taxi into the main city of Kowloon. The staff are friendly, welcoming, well presented and helpful. The rooms are well designed with enough space, are comfortable and the bathroom is spacious with a closet with a WC and another closet containing the shower room. The breakfast was marvelous, such a treat with so much choice of bread, jams, fresh fruit, cereal, juices, coffee and tea. There's also an outdoor swimming pool and lounge area which I saw a couple of people using even in December, but the weather was mild and sunny. If you don't like the crowded feel of Kowloon down near the harbour, then this is the place to stay where you'll be a little off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Hotel in Sha Tin”
Reviews.Author: PrincessZan
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious. Food is quite good. They get the meal orders wrong all the time due to their poor grasp of English but the staff is polite and courteous nonetheless. If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong, this is a good hotel to stay at. Do ask for a room away from rooms allocated for wedding guests as the Chinese celebrate their weddings in their bridal suites as well and the noise can be highly annoying. (I was woken up many times in the morning during weekends) Taxi fares can rip your pockets to shreds what with USD30 per trip to the island so take the train at the University Station, a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The Hong Kong Heritage Museum is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Will Go Again!”
Reviews.Author: Allswell_7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 nights for both business and touring. Although a little removed from the centre of Hong Kong, the position was pleasant as the pace was more comfortable than in the city centre. If racing is on your agenda then this is the ideal location to stay for Sha Tin races. We stayed in a mountain view room which was extremely spacious and provided all the amenities. The staff was all very polite and helpful although not everything ran as efficiently as it could have in regards to check-in and delivery of items to room- this however did not detract from a very pleasant stay. With the hotel being only a short walk to University Station, we found rail travel very efficient and fairly easy to navigate using the maps provided at the station but trains don't run all night which is worth keeping in mind. Travel is safe and Hong Kong trains and stations are the cleanest I've ever seen. The 'Octopus' transport card is worth purchasing, which allows travel on all levels of rail, bus, ferry and extras around Hong Kong. Also taxi fares are so cheap which is another very good option. This was my first time and I fell in love with the place and can't wait to return. HK isn't just high rise and business, it offers diversity of landscape from mountains to beaches and beautiful islands and all easily accessible within a short time frame. Amongst many 'must dos' are- visits to Rainbow Seafood Restaurant Lamma Island, the 'Very Good Seafood Restaurant' Nathan Road and a leisurely stroll along the sea side at Stanley to enjoy coffee and eats after shopping the markets. Hong Kong has so much to offer and it's a credit to the organisational ability and the welcoming nature of its people that make this such a great destination.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, everything a businessman would need and expect.”
Reviews.Author: drivervet
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, that provides all the amenities that a businessman would require. The rooms are a decent size, clean and modern. The Chinese restaurant serves tasty, fresh food and the bar is relaxing. Close to the racetrack, it is a good location for anyone interested in Horseracing.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights in Shatin”
Reviews.Author: Cloted
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on our way out of Hong Kong. Fast efficient check-in with professional staff. Clean spacious room with views across the harbour. Check-out was very slow with a queue of 8 people and only 2 staff on the desk. They were happy to store a bag for us for a couple of weeks until we return for another stay. This is a nice hotel and it met our location requirements (New Territories). It's not close to down-town though, and you need to ride the MTR to get to any resturants or shopping. However, it is only 2 minutes from the MTR station which is a big plus. Internet was very expensive - HK$80 for 1 hour or HK$150 for a day. Quite surprising for such a "connected" city.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY VISIT”
Reviews.Author: kyderby
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel last year. It has not changed. What ever your needs, they seem to excell. The staff is trained and professional. Young proffessional staff is including the door men to the lady who puts your nightly treat in your room! I recommend this Hotel highly. Close to University MTZ, just acouple stops from Sha Tin shopping. Nice pool with a great excerise room. Oh, don't forget the breakfast buffet. Close to the Sha Tin Racecourse.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with almost outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: sibi4
Reviews.Content: I was at Hyatt Shatin for five nights. The location isn't ideal if you want to spend time in Kowloon, and worse for HK island, but the MTR station (University) is just a few steps away and there are a lot of taxis. A ride from the hotel to the airport with 1 suitcase costed me 280 HK $. The hotel chinese Tin 18 restaurant isn't cheap compared to the more real chinese floating restaurant located in Sha Tin, but overall It's good. The cafè à la carte menu is fairly expensive but still good. I had a regency club room, which was very nice. The morning breakfast and evening drinks and canapes were also very good. A bit slow to check in, room wasn't ready for an hour, but I had an early arrival. Hotel laundry was quick and efficient, as well as the concierge services. I eould recommend it and go there again, skipping some meals there and hitting some local restaurants instead. Great to have a regency club room.

Reviews.Title: “Still very good but has slipped at the edges”
Reviews.Author: manitree
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because it is a good, new hotel with nice, spacious rooms and adequate facilities (quiet well-equipped gym, quiet pool) in addition to our long term association with the Hyatt brand. There have been several comments on the distance from the city proper. As compensation there are many places to eat in Shatin (e.g. C Jade) and Tai Po market, a traditional HK township. Victoria Harbour restaurant in the building next to Tai Po market station has good dim sum in the morning). Shatin Central has all the same brands as Causeway Bay and almost as crowded on weekends. It is near the China border. The hotel is only 500m from University Station. Besides direct taxi from the Airport, the A21 (hkd 22.50) connects to Shatin Central where you can take a taxi or MTR to the hotel. Also, the hotel has a shuttle (9.30 am and 1pm) to Elements / Hong Kong Station for Tsim Sha Tsui or the airport. The regency club has a nice spread of canapes. We enjoyed the Peking duck at Shatin 18. Melo spa has a grand room, spa and showers, etc and the massage is what you can expect in a hotel. What we found a bit disappointing was that most of the enthusiastic staff we met on our last trip seem to have left (possibly to newer Hyatt in Tsim Sha Tsui).

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and noisy room”
Reviews.Author: fishtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time I stay in this hotel and I always stay for three to four nights. I was in Hong Kong for a business trip with my wife and booked a King Size mountain view room. After checking in and confirming with reception that our room was ready, we were sent to a twin bed room, that was not only what we had not been promised but was also quite dirty (stains) and definitely smelly (lack of airing the room altogether as the aircon switches off as soon as you leave the room and the windows don't open!) Once we finally got the room we had booked, we spent a pretty poor first night in the room as a lot of noise could be heard from the neighbours from what seemed to be a wedding party. The next morning, i asked for the aircon to be left on, but as this was impossible, I asked for the windows to be opened during the day so as to air the room. when we got back around 10pm, the room smelled fresh, we only realized later that both windows were still open and were letting in the noise of the passing MTR so I had to call reception at about 0130 am so they could close the windows using a special key! We ate at the buffet once for dinner, the buffet is nice but in the end, it is also pretty expensive! In all, frankly speaking, Hong Kong hotels are not giving you good value for the low season prices, not to talk about the outrageous prices they charge when you are there during one of the numerous busy periods/fairs/holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “A SUB-PAR HYATT”
Reviews.Author: Fayaya
Reviews.Content: At first blush, the hotel looks like a Hyatt. But try to reach the front desk--its impossible. They will eventually phone you back. I was here on business, but first night was on my own dime. So, they changed my room the following day since business paid for a cheaper room. It smelled like an ash tray--unbearable. Could not reach the front desk. Finally, they wanted to move me into a room that was directly across from the elevator. That way, I could stay awake all night listening to the bell. How thoughtful! Finally, I got a room that was OK. That is how I spent a good part of an afternoon. What else? Well, I returned from the meeting to find my door open--the maid had not properly shut it after cleaning. I guess there is a first time for everything. Toilet would run--the little button on the tank was not functioning. Long lines at reception (explains why they won't answer the phone). No stream-lined check out. In other words, piles of annoyances. I hope not to ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but isolated”
Reviews.Author: walloper25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for the racecourse and university but no shops nearby. Train within 150 yards which is easy to use and cheap

Reviews.Title: “It's great, but NOT in Shatin!”
Reviews.Author: fairhsa
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, adjacent to the University MTR stop. Pity they didn't make access from the MTR easier - the lower level door is very hard to navigate with luggage and there are no doorman or help down there. A minor whinge. Otherwise we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel (just one night). We paid extra for a Club room, the Club lounge is FABULOUS - really good cocktails and breakfast (one of the best I have seen); helpful staff. Lobby is noisy - full of tourists and mainlanders, but once you get up to the club floor, it's peaceful and quiet. We got an upgrade to a suite - nice size for HK (the benefit of being in Tai Po and not Central). Very convenient for the University. Nice views over the river from room and lounge. Didn't try much else!

Reviews.Title: “Do you want to be in Sha Tin?”
Reviews.Author: glenaToronto
Reviews.Content: This is a very solid, well-run Hyatt Hotel. Like other hotels in the chain, the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin has very nice rooms wirh good bedding, a luxurious washroom, and all the facilities you will need. My room had a comfortable desk for working, a wonderful separate shower, and a nice large television with some good English-language channels. The service was first rate.The breakfast buffet was excellent. The dinner buffet has a wide range of options, but it is quite expensive and there are far more interesting interesting options available if you are willing to jump on the transit system next door. Internet access was quite expensive. Nice pool. The key question here is do you need to be in Sha Tin? This is a great option if you are visiting the Chinese University of Hong Kong or attending a local conference (as I was), but that is really the only real reason to be here. There is nothing around this hotel except for a small variety store and a couple of restaurants for students or commuters. You can walk to the waterfront in a few minutes for some nice views, but the immediate area does not have any specific sights, stores, restaurants or other facilities. You need to take the train or a taxi to go anywhere - of course this is very easy to do, but you can find hotel options that will provide you with much easier opportunities to explore Hong Kong. In short, this is a great hotel if you need to be in Sha Tin, but a pretty mediocre choice if you plan to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, well appointed hotel a bit out of the way if you are looking to be on Central”
Reviews.Author: DiverDanSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly new and adjacent to the University. Conference facilities were good (AV, food, internet access etc). Good gym and a decent sized outside pool. Main cafe restaraunt on the lobby level serves a wide range of good quality food (better than many). Rooms are well appointed and with a fair bit of space in them...comfortable. Access to transport is good with only 400 metres to Bus and train station. Just bear in mind if you are going into central from here by train (HKD$15.5) a) allow 40-50 minutes and b) recognise you will change twice. Taxi (except in peak) will take around 25-30 minutes (HKD$215). The whole front desk thing does not work that well...too few staff to service demand and in one case 3 staff sorting out 1 guests issue...not very efficient. It was not as though anyone was leaping forward to try and solve the issue either. Rates are better than one would get in central.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but not so good location”
Reviews.Author: neat_chic20
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really spacious and the beddings are excellent. We got a room overlooking the nice pool and mountains. I like how the bathroom is designed esp the tub with clear glass which allows you to watch tv while doing your bubble bath. Everything you needed is just inside the room from comprehensive toiletries, bath robe, etc. Room service breakfast is good. They serve really good food at the restaurant, the buffet is worth the try. This is recommended for long-stay esp if you want to enjoy the well maintained facilities such as gym and pool. Wifi in the rooms are not for free.The only thing I didn't like about it (aside from the costly wifi) is that it's quite far from the central. I traveled with my mom and since she's not as active as me, I find it a bit of a hassle to pass several stations and keep changing lines before reaching the hotel after a long day of sightseeing and malling. I should have done my research well. In short, if you are with young travelers looking for a 5 star class that would not ruin your budget, Id give this an excellent rating.
