But if you are with senior travelers or with small children better consider the other hotels nearby the central.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Vivian L
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really nice, just beside HongKong Chinese University, My room was a mountain view, it was quite nice. they also have a big pool outside, it's a pity that i didn't bring my swimming suits. general living was comfortable and enjoyable. Check in procedure was quick, the staff was experienced, but didn't mention about the free service like transportation, or any F&B outlet for upselling. girls at the front desk didn't wear make up. that's a bit surprise. The lunch buffet was good, however the staff was not as friendly as i thought, no smile during service. and the billing service was very slow. Check out service was better than check in. maybe because of different staff. the attitude of drivers were different either. general impression of younger staff were more friendly in the hotel. don't know why. I wanna thank the concierge boy named Jacob, he was very helpful to ask if i wanna store my lugguage and pick up my water in the room after i checked out. Vivian Liu

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrick074
Reviews.Content: This is really a hidden gem in hong kong. If you don't mind staying a bit farther from the Hong kong City centre, this is the place to be. Big rooms by Hong Kong Standard, located right next to the University MTR station. Services are what you would expect from Hyatt, good and efficient. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dowzy1234
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great rooms and facilities. It has a great gym and swimming pool. However they seem to try and charge you for absolutely everything. You would think that a chain as large as hyatt, with it's room rates, would include free or very cheap wifi but it is extortionate. And the business centre charges quite a bit to use the printer and for paper.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Accomodation with a 4 Star Price-Tag (if you don't mind the distance)”
Reviews.Author: Wasabi
Reviews.Content: As the hotel name suggested, this is an international 5-star chain hotel and you would expect all the amenties and service level from a Hyatt. The hotel is relatively big, with over 500 rooms (133 of them are for long stay). I stayed there for 4 nights in October 2011. + + The Location + + The hotel is located in an area called The University in New Territories Hong Kong. It is not actually in Sha Tin as the hotel name suggested. Sha Tin is another suburb from the hotel and it is 2 train stations away from The University station. The nearest shopping centre from the hotel is in Shatin which can be reached by scheduled hotel shuttle, or by MTR train or by taxi. Access to/from the hotel: 1. By MTR train - The hotel is about 5 minute walk from the MTR station "The University" which can then take you to most part of Hong Kong including the Hong Kong island, Disneyland, Hong Kong airport, Shatin, Kowloon and ShenZheng China. 2. By Hotel Shuttle - There is one hotel shuttle mini-bus travelling to/from the hotel, Shatin, Kowloon MTR and Kowloon Hyatt Hotel. The mini-bus is free but they are not frequent and there is no space for the luggage. It has limited seats and they do not accept reservation. 3. By Taxi - Taxi are almost always ready on stand-by outside the hotel. 4. By Bus - The local bus terminal is next to the MTR station but it only goes to the suburban areas. As a rough guide, it will take you about 45 min. by taxi to the airport, 15 min to Shatin and 30 min to Kowloon, 45 min to Hong Kong Island. + + The Hotel + + This 5 star hotel has 2 restaurants, 1 for the buffet next to the lobby and another one specialised in Chinese food. It also has a pool bar and a 5 star fitness centre which has a separate male/female spa, a sauna room, a steam room as well as a gym and an outdoor swimming pool. The fitness centre is a rare find in Hong Kong and we enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere. The lobby is good but not grand although seats are limited (which is disappointing) There are only 3 lifts to the room and they are mostly full during busy hours (another disappointment) + + The Room + + The room is very clean and is very new when we were there. We stayed in the Harbour View Twin Roomwhich is still a good size with 40 sq metres for the Hong Kong standard. The room over look the Shatin harbour which is a blessing. The room design is modern with a huge glass window (with curtain) from the bathroom overlooking the room and the harbour. Shower and toilet have separate doors. Inside the room you can find everything a 5 star hotel have. Good quality bathroom amenities, big wardrobes and safe are all standard. Flat LCD TV with cable TV channels. Two telephones (one in the bathroom), an umbrella, a fridge, a power plug adoptor and a writing desk. + + The Restaurant + + There are 2 restaurants, the one near the lobby serves buffet style international food. The chinese restaurant called Shatin 21 serves traditional cantonese chinese food. On the weekend, the bar next to the swimming pool also serves BBQ buffet dinner. Food is great and service is excellent. Nonetheless, unless your room rates include the meal, price is also 5 stars - i.e,. expensive. ** Things I like about this hotel ** 1. The Fitness Centre - The spa, the sauna, the steam room, big changing room and they are not stingy with the towels and bathroom amenities. 2. The Swimming Pool - With a Bar - Very relaxing. 3. The Price - Cheaper than other 5 stars hotel in Hong Kong most of the time but you get the same quality. 4. The Location - It is next to the MTR station. 5. The free shuttle bus. ** Things I don't like about this hotel ** 1. The Location - It is still far from many Hong Kong attractions even the hotel is right next to the MTR station. 2. The Lift - The lifts can be full easily. ===== Overall ===== If you do not mind the traveling time, then this hotel is a bargin for the 5 star quality it has. My Tip - There is a fast food style chinese restaurant called Maxi next to the MTR station if you prefer the non-5 star.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced mirage with a quagmire of hidden fees beneath it”
Reviews.Author: deorr
Reviews.Content: The accomodations at the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin are gorgeous, but are marred by hidden fees and mediocre service. Want a queen bed instead of two twins? It's extra. Want to use the WiFi? It's $150 HKD per day (approximately $20 USD). Breakfast? Starts at $169 HKD a day for pastries. Need to print something out at the business center? That's an additional $110 HKD per hour for use of the computer plus $5 HKD per page. These are all services that a 45 RMB a night business hotel in Shanghai provides at no additional cost. Plus once you're at the Hyatt Sha Tin, you're a captive audience. The hotel is located 30 to 40km away from the airport and the main portions of the city, and the regional MTR line that it is situated on closes well before most of the metro. Expect a cab ride of $150 to $300 HKD each time you want to return to the hotel past 10pm. As for the service, it was unremarkable except for the business center, which was terrible. The hotel apparently chose the middle of a work day to do some sort of construction project that required loud drilling. Someone's kid was running around the room and screaming. And one of the few staff members present was tying up the printer with what appeared to be her personal correspondence. Like I said, the hotel is lovely. But if you're not going for the pool, do yourself a favor, learn from my mistake, and stay at a comparable hotel in Hong Kong proper. The nightly rate may be a little higher, but odds are you'll save both money and aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed!”
Reviews.Author: daikin
Reviews.Content: I do agree with others that this is a superb hotel with new and clean rooms with a wonderful view of Tolo Harbour. The main reason is it presents a great value, although it has something to do with it being so far out. If you don't mind spending 45 minutes and transferring three MTR lines to get to Central then this is the right hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mac147
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I've stayed in. Rooms are excellent and very well cleaned. The air con is very good. The internet is fast and reliable. The staff go out of their way to be helpful. I can't find any real fault I think that's a first for me. Location is a fair way from town but transit station is very near couple minutes walk. Wheelchair accessibility is practical perfect. Rooms have roll in shower. I prefer bath so was given a room with this. Although not a accessible room it was better than most specially adapted rooms. The pool is wheelchair accessible and that is rare in my experience. So if location works for you then you will be happy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5-start-buy in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: BPfromTO
Reviews.Content: I received the expected 5 Stars Hyatt regency service. Large hotel rooms for Hong Kong, Wonderful view of Tolo Harbour. There is the Univerity MTR Station next door. Green and quiet countryside location. 5 minutes travel to the convenient high-end New City Plaza or the economical City Link Plaza at the Sha Tin Station ( 2 MTR stops). It is 30 minutes to Tsim Sha Tsui either by MTR ( 2 changes of trains) or by the Hyatt courtesy shutle bus, if the timing is right. I'd much prefer it to the expensive hotels in the conjested dowtown areas! Con: HK$150 a day, or $500 for a week for WiFi service in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: asjiwani
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights for a business trip to hong kong, every thing is all perfect, good houskeeping, nice and friendly staff, quick check inn and out, got the room requested also got late check out request, rooms are very good and comfortable specially the bedding , all facilities are available, the wifi is charged that should not for inhouse guest.overall good experiance and a good alternative as tired of other hk hotels with small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Breath-taking view from the hotel room. Near to train station and very new!”
Reviews.Author: Shook_Singapore
Reviews.Content: Been there for my last year hong kong trip. It wasn't my first time in Hong kong and always find that the hotels in the city are too expensive or old. Came across this new hotel at shatin. Initial thought was too far from the city but it's not actually the case. There is a train station within 5 mins walk and we could reach the city within 1/2 hour. The rooms are new and spacious. Great view of hills from the room and Good customer service. Last but not least, reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a business trip to CUHK”
Reviews.Author: OxfordLizzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip to the Chinese University of HK. The rooms were spacious, comfortable, clean and I had a nice view over the harbour. The bathrooms were fantastic - I liked the partitioning between the (very large) walk-in shower, the toilet and the bath/shower/sink area. Some earlier reviews had mentioned that there is a glass wall/large window between the bathroom and the bedroom, this is true but there is also a blind which you can easily put down, and there is total privacy as the shower and toilet are in separate cublicles anyway. I actually liked this feature is it makes the room feel even larger and brings natural light into the bathroom if you opt to keep the blind up. I ate at the Sha Tin 18 restaurant on the 1st night. It was pricey but delicious and I loved the decor. I also had a very nice cocktail or two in the 'Tin Tin' bar which has a dark sophisticated black and red colour theme, and had some nice but unobtrusive live music. The breakfast buffet each morning was fantastic with a huge choice of Chinese and western options. My only complaint was the black tea which was poured from a pot rather than freshly prepared. It didn't taste great, would be better if they gave you the tea bag and hot water to make your own. I later found out that this is the training hotel for CUHK's Hotel and Tourism Management degree programme and they certainly do a good job. Check-in/out were smooth and (after a little negotiation) they allowed me to use the room for another few hours after I should have checked out, so that I could come back and get changed after my meeting. The location is perfect if you are coming to CUHK and it's right on the doorstep of the MTR station, but it is a long way from the airport which is not a problem in itself, you just need to factor in how you are going to make the journey (I opted for a taxi on the way there and the MTR on the way back) and do be aware that it's not near the main action hot spots of HK, although these are easily accessible by MTR/taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chinese restaurant”
Reviews.Author: BrotherYo
Reviews.Content: Been there to visit friends. Spacious Lobby, pleasant rooms, green surroundings. Mouth watering Peking Duck melting as you savor the taste in their nicely decorated Chinese restaurant. Friendly and amiable service. Not much to do around the hotel. Seems like a place fo an enjoyable week-end away from the bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Prozach
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip to Chinese University. The room was great, with all the amenities that we are used to from the US. The room and bathroom were spacious. The shower was huge and the bath tub was a plus. The breakfast buffet was fantastic with both Chinese and Western fare. They had a peanut sauce for the freshly-made mini pancakes. Fantastic sauce, and combined with maple syrup....yum. They had freshly-squeezed juices including my favorite carrot juice. Dinner buffet is quite pricey but worth it. When i was there they had a special Indian fare. The hotel is a quick walk from University MRT station, which make many of the usual tourist spots easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in limited location”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveller77
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in - the Chinese restaurant does a Peking Duck to die for and other dishes and the cafe are nearly as good. Rooms are really good too and it is right at University station and a bus interchange BUT there is nothing nearby - you have to get on the train, bus or take a taxi to get ot a shop or other eating place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, new, hotel”
Reviews.Author: highcountrytraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Sha Tin hotel during a recent business trip. The hotel is very nice, with large, well designed rooms and comfortable beds. My room had a great view over the river. The bathroom had a walk-in shower and a separate bath. The breakfast buffet had a large variety of food, and the quality was excellent. Unfortunately, dinner off the menu in the Cafe was not so great. The dinner buffet may have been better. The rooms have both wired and wireless internet access, which worked well, but was an extra charge. I don't like this policy, but it is common in mid to high end hotels. (Lower cost hotels do not see the need to charge extra for Internet access, so this charge is more of an opportunity for the hotel than a necessity.) I was there only for business, so I cannot comment on how far the hotel may be from downtown Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & good value”
Reviews.Author: ASUprof
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks [and got a good discount] and were very pleased. The somewhat distant location from the central HK area is not a problem, as the metro [MTR] station ["University"] is right next to the 26-story hotel, as are several bus terminals. The Chinese University of Hong Kong is also next door, and the hotel even has a few students from the CUHK doing internships in the hotel. The outdoor pool is outstanding, room and maid service is fast and efficient, and the restaurants are good if somewhat expensive. We came back for two days in August, and discovered that if one pays 8 days in advance, a room discount is available. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, cosy, romantic!”
Reviews.Author: mitinkkumar
Reviews.Content: Ideal peaceful location.....a bit far from main downtown but then we were exactly looking to leave the city humdrum behind so perfect for us as a couple looking to spend some quality time with each other.....very well connected by MTR so no commuting issues as well (University MTR station adjacent to hotel).....plus bus station as well as loadsa taxis available too easily.....excellent property, staff and service!

Reviews.Title: “Great view and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Wistin
Reviews.Content: Have a nice room with Harbour City View, room and hotel is clean, staff provided an friendly service and helpful. Convenience to connect to various location around Hong Kong by the short walk to University Station. Travel between airport to the hotel by taxi approximately 30 minutes and may cost about HK$ 280.-

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious vacation...”
Reviews.Author: elenaAthens
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel!!!Just brilliant!!!Fantastic room with pool view...Every evening we spent couple of hours there to relax.Next to the pool there is also a jacuzzi!!!It has fantastic views to the mountains..!Convenient location, near metro station.Last day we had to had to wait a couple of hours to catch our flight and they let us use the pool and facilities in order to have a shower and change clothes!!!I would stay there for sure again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobtown55
Reviews.Content: So far it was the best Hotel I´ve stayed in Hong Kong. Overall very friendly staff and also the Hotel restaurants offering a very good quality of different dishes. For me it was surprising and the price level is compared to others. The hotel is close to the East Line MTR station, University.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel well positioned in New Territories”
Reviews.Author: Buggalugs
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is the 7th hotel I have stayed in HK, the 3rd in Sha Tin, it is certainly the best, less than 2 years old, very well appointed, right next to University station, with very convenient complimentry bus service to the Science and Technology Park. Thus if visiting the S&T Park, it is excellent. Brilliant value compared to staying on the Island or in TST.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Alternative”
Reviews.Author: HCBIII
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong hotel prices have increased substantially over the last ten years, so I decided to look at alternatives. I found the Hyatt, Sha Tin to be an excellent choice. About a 20-30 minute MTR ride/walk from Kowloon, or you can take a shuttle bus. The hotel is in excellent condition, and the staff was well trained and very attentive. I stayed on the club level and recommend this for the amenities and view. Also, an excellent place to stay for transitioning to the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel in a resort like location”
Reviews.Author: althaus
Reviews.Content: While Sha Tin might not be the first choice of location for tourists, the Hyatt in Sha Tin is a very good place to stay. Their club rooms are cheaper than other standard rooms in Kowloon or Central and the hotel has complimentary shuttle service to their sister property in Tsim Sha Tsui. The city is perhaps 20 minutes by taxi and 40 minutes by subway. Located next to the Chinese University of HK, the hotel is beside the University MTR station, and offers visitors the chance to visit nearby attractions like the suburb of Sha Tin and the Horse Racing venue. There is a large shopping mall in Sha Tin too for guests looking to shop in HK. Regency club guests have a separate check in at the club lounge which has fantastic Harbour views. The evening snacks and breakfast in the lounge are also excellent and one of the best in any hotel club lounges! I was allocated a room on the corner which was the size of a suite with sofa, table, work desk, dressing table and TV console. Huge bathrooms have separate bathtub and shower area. One of the nicest and largest standard rooms in HK. Mountain view rooms sometimes have views of th racetrack so there is no need for club guests to book Harbour view rooms since they can experience it from the lounge. A tip to guests in the hotel is to arrive early for the morning shuttles to Tsim Sha Tsui as they can get packed quite fast. This is also the same case for the last shuttle of the day back to Sha Tin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an out of the way location”
Reviews.Author: AllanChg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great but is half an hour from the city. Fortunately, it is right at the University train station and the hotel runs a free shuttle to Kowloon station and the Hyatt in Tsim Sha Tsui. If you don't want to be in the noise and crowd of Hong Kong, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Don't accept 'No'”
Reviews.Author: Austinhealey3000_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed early July 2011, 2 adults, 2 teenagers. It is a lovely hotel for a Hong Kong holiday, out of the crush, but right on the railway. Small 7/11 in station no alcohol, unfortunately that's all between you and a train ride to a shopping mall. Club rooms good, free wi-fi (cable and wireless). Club staff are good, culturally they must mix your drinks, unlike other club lounges. If you try to pour your own they feel offended, it is not about portion control. However, when the weather is difficult (six months of the year) the pool is closed for days on end because there are 'storm warnings'. No storm? It is for 'safety'. The pool lounges are packed up in 30 degree heat for 'safety'. There is nothing else to do at the hotel especially for teenagers. I eventually won the battle. It took nearly an hour trying to convince the duty manager that it was a hotel policy not a Chinese by-law. That warnings are not storms. Planes are not grounded in 'warnings', the hotel never told us that they just arbitarily close the pool when the weather forcast is for possible storms. They have so many staff at every point, they could do anything. They don't. I went to the concierge at midday, no other customer in the lobby, eight staff -yes eight- staff at concierge desk all willing to say 'no', you have to fight for every request - always poiltely - but everywhere in the hotel, they say 'no', then have to be talked around. Move the umbrella? No, - extra chair at a table in the restaurant? No. There are about 10 well trained staff, and the other 100 seem to be trainees for export to the other Hyatt hotel in Kowloon. And 'No' is the order of the day. A nice little bakery off the lobby, but select from the display, because if you vary your sandwich contents, they call the restaurant kitchen, and you wait, and wait, and 15 minutes later a chef appears resplendent in uniform, full apron and hat, holding a plate with one sandwich on it. It could be so good with just a little bit of management on display. There is not. Asking to see the duty manager takes 20 minutes with to and fro requests for your name, then your room number before he will even speak to you. As a commute hotel it does not matter, as a holiday destination for a week, don't lose your nerve, ask for the duty manager, be prepared to wait, be polite but do not take 'No' for an answer

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just out of the way”
Reviews.Author: WilmslowRoger
Reviews.Content: If you know your way around hong kong this is a great value hotel, superb facilities and service at a reasonable pice, but a taxi to central will cost £40, it's closet to the mtr, but a trip to central takes 45 mins, great views from the room I had and a great ( but very quiet) hotel bar. Well equipped gym and I never saw another person in it despite using it ever day for 2 weeks stay!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: prince_of_roam
Reviews.Content: Very low end version of the Hyatt properties. Its ok for the price but rooms are small and its far away from the city. Staff was not willing to upgrade despite being a Hyatt Platinum member (whats irking is that he didnt even check availability until I insisted). Water views are ok, but that depends on how well you haggle for the room with view. Don't expect alot...

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel but cool and aloof feeling”
Reviews.Author: siangjiao
Reviews.Content: Rooms - Very spacious, compared to the typical HK downtown hotels. I had a room on the 5th floor, with a balcony. Not too sure if i can walk out as the door seemed stucked, but one evening, hubby actually found the door opened when we returned. Luckily none of our stuff were missing. Views was zero on the 5th floor. Design was modern, facilities was clean. Bathroom - Love the rainshower. Though the bathtub is by a transparent glass, there is no sound system in the bathroom. Beds - King size was huge, bigger than the typical asia size. Super comfy, sheets were smooth and clean. Entertainment - Not much channels. Simply bad reception. Not much use for the 42 inch TV. But love the magazines provided eg. National geographic, timeout HK , Newsweek etc. Location - about 45 mins from Central, and 20 minutes to Mongkok by MTR. The station is at University MTR, 10 mins away from Shatin station where there is a huge shopping mall, with food. Too bad, the shops at the mall does not open till 11am on a week days, but there are some food joints opened if you don't wanna have brekkie at the hotel. There is a 7-11 located right at the university MTR. My hubby stock up the beer from there. There is also a place offering soups and desserts along the MTR that opens till 11.30 pm in the evenings. Love the herbal tea egg. If you choose room service, it's not too expensive either; i've seen other exhorbitant prices at other Hyatts. Shuttle - There is a shuttle (but the timings are bad, eg. 1300 and the next one at 1900). If you can catch them, you can actually get to the kowloon station (which is also an airport express station) within 30 mins. The same bus runs to Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui which is a 3 min walk to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. Service - hmm... how should i describe? very discrete, very professional, very efficient but total lack of warmth and smiles. Yeah, you ask something, the response more than often is fast and "No" without checking. But if you prompt a little, yeah, they run that extra mile (and No can become Yes easily sometimes). Well controlled expressionless facial language, with little discrete tones between staff (too bad, i don't understand Cantonese) (but somehow i get the feeling they're not too sincere about additional requests). Not a very homely feeling definitely, but i supposed that is the atas feeling the staff wants to potray. Overall, i'll come back to stay (I have no issues about unsmiley staff who wish to act untouchable), mainly for the room space and comfort. It was a 3 day summer sale shopping trip for me, and with the 3 day MTR tourist card which allows unlimited MTR travel, 7-1/2 months preggy tummy, and loads of shopping bags, i still didn't find travelling to and from from town all too bothersome. One side point, if you need internet, get one of those prepaid data SIM cards from HK. I used the one from 3com. Can be easily slid into your Ipad 2 or Iphone 4. Available at 7-11 at HKD198. The max data charge is like HKD28 a day only and you are connected whereever you go. Maybe other telcoms have better packages, but this is good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Odd”
Reviews.Author: LanPing
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located close to the University MTR station, this is a large modern building with views over Tolo Harbour. It is not in any way old or shabby, but doesn't look modern either - I would estimate mid 1990's. Clean and airy, good standard linen and upholstery, but below normal standards - this reminded me of a Crowne Plaza rather than a Hyatt My room was a spacious Suite with a comprehensive kitchen area; however, although there was a minibar, there were no coffee making facilities and - unsurprisingly therefore - none of the cooking equipment appeared to have been used recently, if at all TV reception was lousy, with very few satellite channels available

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay in the middle of nowhere.”
Reviews.Author: chadontheroad
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Sha Tin is a beautiful 5 star hotel, perfectly furnished and properly staffed. On my recent stay there over the weekend with a couple of my buddies, we had an overall excellent stay with only a few idiosyncrasies to detract from it being otherwise perfect. The Location: 25 minutes from the Lowu station (Shenzhen Border Crossing) made this a breeze for leaving and re-entering China. The fact that you walk out the front door of the hotel and into the MTR station made it even better. This is a 5 star aspect. The fact that the station you are walking into is University on the east rail line means that you are at one of the only stations in Hong Kong that has no 7-11 or anything else for that matter within a 10 minute drive, except of course, the Hyatt hotel. This is bad for two reasons: In the morning when you don’t want to pay 50 HKD for a coffee and a croissant, or at 1 am when you want a pizza, and the 24 hour room services notes that they stop serving their 200 HKD pizzas at 10pm. This is not a 5 star aspect. The food and facilities: When we arrived after a night of partying in Shenzhen, I had a lunch meeting to attend immediately as we arrived. So we headed to quickly check in, but were unhappy to see a line of 20 people all with the same idea. So no room to change out of my flip-flops and the Tshirt from the night before, but the bellman did direct me to the pool change room. It was perfect. In 5 start Hong Kong style, it was fitted with lockers, showers, toothbrushes a sauna and a hottub. I took a 2 minute shower and helped myself to a toothbrush and comb. I then headed off to the hotel’s restaurant for my lunch meeting. The meeting went well, thanks in great part to the catering… The hotel weekend buffet was amazing; loads of seafood, western and Chinese dishes, and a mixed grill to die for. They had about as many choices of grilled meats as a Brazilian steakhouse, and a full selection of HK BBQ as well! The salad station featured individually mixed Caesar salads and the dessert station was built around fresh baked Sha Tin apple pies (which you could also purchase boxed to go in the café). Four rounds and I was went away feeling like I got my money’s worth, which at $50+ USD per person was not an easy thing to do. Considering that my glass was always full, and my stomach ended up likewise, this was also a 5 star aspect of our stay. The property: Upon arrival we were delayed to check in, so we chose to eat. When we returned to check in an hour and a half later, we were told the rooms were not ready, this did turn out to be a benefit, as they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite that was probably in the vicinity of 1000 square feet, sporting 3 bathrooms, 3 42” or larger TVs a kitchenette, and a 30th floor view of the harbour and surrounding mountains. From looking around from up top, I came to realize that there was absolutely nothing nearby in the form of shopping or eating. We spent the next couple of hours waiting to check in next to the swimming pool, where I considered having a beer until I found out that they charge the price of a 6pack for single can. If only there was a 7-11. The pool was excellent, nice and cool on a 35 degree day. It had been typhoonish only days prior to our arrival, so it was our good fortune that the sky was clear and blue and the sun was burning down on us, melting away the responsibilities that lay in wait for each of us back in Shanghai. 5 star room with a 5 star pool. Cons: As most HK hotels, you have to pay about $20 USD per day for internet. Fortunately we could use connectify to share the signal between all 3 of our computers and cellphones, otherwise this would have been a fortune. The long wait to check in was not really acceptable, but the recompense was highly favourable. Upon checkout, I found out that because I had booked on Agoda, that I received no rewards on my Hyatt Gold Passport, I was disappointed and more than slightly surprised. What’s the point of having the points program if you aren’t going to give them out if people use an agency, or at least let me know when I am booking that you are going to hold out on me! That would be a deal-breaker for me in the future, and a reason to consider another property next time instead of Hyatt, since most other high end hotels give the benefit of finding a deal online, thank you for your patronage by giving you the reward benefits, no matter how you got there. Overall the Hyatt Sha Tin is an excellent resort/business style hotel that is easily accessible, but at least half an hour from anywhere or anything. Quiet, clean, and efficient, I would be happy to stay at this hotel again, or even just stop there for lunch on my next trip into HK for the buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice - Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights and was very happy with my choice. Staff were always very helpful and the facilities excellent. Very close to MTR (university). Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “The view was awesome from the room”
Reviews.Author: aditidhelia
Reviews.Content: The hotel although situated very far from the city is welcome break of sorts from the hustle bustle of the city! The view from the harbour view room is panoramic with cloud covered mountains across the sea !! the staff is by far excellent!! helpful connectivity thru train is great! great place to stay if u wish to stay away from the city life!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: christineliu
Reviews.Content: Stay at Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Sha Tin for one night with family for two rooms. Friendly staff from check in, spa, swimming pool, cafe till check out. You just feeled at home. We enjoyed the buffet and pool bar snake very much, we spend most of our time at the pool and spa with wonderful experience. What a plasant stay ! Good for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, could be great with a few small improvements”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_AU
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip for 3 nights in June. If you want to stay outside of the main Hong Kong areas then this is a great location. It's right next to University MTR so access to the rest of Hong Kong is easy. Unfortunately, it's location can also be a hinderance. There are no other restaurants are dining options nearby so taking the MTR to Sha Tin station is the closest. It's also difficult to get there from the airport, unless taking a taxi (approx HK$250) as there are no shuttle bus companies that go to the area. Booking a Club room gives you access to the Club lounge for cooked breakfast to order, evening cocktails and a fantastic view over the harbour. The room rate also includes wireless internet access throughout the hotel, otherwise it is HK$350 for 72Hrs. I'm unsure of the cost for breakfast in the restaurant. Overall, the lounge was nice, however the staff service and attention to details weren't as good as other hotel lounges/clubs. The room itself was very spacious with a very comfortable bed, excellent work desk area and large TV screen. TV channels are the usual ones you get in Asia, with several English channels available covering news, sport and movies. Bathroom was very spacious with separate shower and bath, and the amenities were excellent. There were some issues with the temperature of the room as it fluctuated quite significantly and the cooling seemed to come in bursts. The gym was excellent - spacious and with good equipment in good working order. The pool was huge, capable of doing laps if you're inclined, with plenty of sun lounges and umbrellas provided. It is heated to a good temperature, although it would be nice to be a little bit colder to help cool off from the heat. Overall, a recommended hotel if you don't need to stay in a central location, only let down by a few little things that can quite easily be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LouSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Have travelled to Hong Kong quite a few times over the last few years, and this is by far our favourite hotel here. The staff are extremely friendly, while being very efficient - nothing is too much trouble. We have stayed here 6 times now, they greet us by name as soon as we arrive, and make us feel very welcome. The staff in the Regency Club are superb - although we find this is the case in most Hyatt's in this part of the world and Europe. Have not been to any in the USA. Nice to come back here after a busy day amongst all the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong to somewhere a bit quieter. The difference in the price of the rooms also is a big consideration as compared to the other 2 Hyatt's in HK (we have also stayed in both the Grand and TST) Service as good,but much more affordable when not on expenses !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service but too far away!”
Reviews.Author: sunshineseema
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it's beautiful has a lovely pool and a spa. It is close to both a MTR station and a bus stop but it does take at least an hour to all the tourist spots in Hong Kong and if you want to experience the nightlife then you have no choice but to take a cab back and it can actually be pretty expensive. Worth staying at if you have work in that area and not if you are a tourist in Hong Kong. The bathroom is amazing, it's like it's own room, we had a twin room with a gorgeous view of the pool and the room came with a tub and a separate shower area. It really was a beautifully designed hotel and the breakfast buffet is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: kattavh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in late 2009 and really enjoyed it. The best part is they partnered to have a shuttle to and from the airport making this a perfect place to go from HK and head into town for meetings while being in a calmer environment. Well.. they had a shuttle and despite two requests to clarify, they never wrote back. So I took a taxi and fought with the driver the whole way there only to arrive with essentially no sympathy or understanding of their lack of clarification. The chain is good and the hotel is normally good and I am a gold club member and reserved one of the more premium rooms.. but still no compassion for the frustration caused. Check in and check out is also a gong show as the staff are very inefficient and could use some retraining. Being a reputable chain, I was disappointed with their service levels and would not come back here. Other premium chains offer far better services.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, close to subway, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: loversfromanisland
Reviews.Content: North of the main central area of Hong Kong, this hotel was quieter and a comfortable place to go back and relax. Right next to the subway station, it takes only a few minutes to get anywhere you want to go in Hong Kong. It takes five minutes to get to a major shopping mall. The view out the window was beautiful -- water, mountains -- all the things that make Hong Kong unique. The price was very reasonable, much less than we would have paid downtown. Service and amenities were great.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really what 5* living has come down to!?!”
Reviews.Author: Adventuring101
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and I was unimpressed to say the least. I had a harbour view room, and the view and the glass between the bathroom and bedroom, to enjoy the view, was about all that impressed me. In my opinion, this hotel barely makes a 4*, and that's just because of the decent gym, hot tub and swimming pool they have. The bathroom had some mould stains, nothing that a good scrub could not fix and yet they were there. You have to pay for internet (in this day and age!?!), at about 150 HKD for 24 hours, I mean really! Bed was comfortable. Concierge, knowledgeable. 5 min from University MRT station. Lots of door banging and loud talking from hotel staff. I would only recommend this place if you get a good deal, otherwise, its quite far from a 5* experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Thing about our HK Holiday is the Hotel and the service”
Reviews.Author: Disppointed50
Reviews.Content: It might seemed strange that when our friends asked us what is the best thing about our Hk holiday, without hesitation we both said the hotel and the service. We have been to Hk on our previous trip but stayed in town. Upon checking previous reviews and also being a celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary, we wanted a quite place where we would be pampered. So we chose the Club King room at Hyatt Regency for a great 7 day advance purchase price and stayed for 8 nights. Got upgraded to a suite and was also glad that we chose the Club package as we had access to the Club lounge - simple but still ample breakfast with choice of 2 hot dishes as well as lots of goodies- tea and coffee all day and the very best was the "Drinks and canapes "hours between 5.30pm till 7.30pm. Great service and great atmosphere- perched high above the hotel on the 25th flr overlooking the Tolo harbour. The great service and other wonderful things about teh hotel: 1) Ken, the concierge - who went out of his way to get us two concert tickets for International Jazz Guitarists at the Skylark Club and then fantastic instructions on how to get there - change MTR 3 times and still made it on time to have a drink before the concert. This is one of the many requests and info which he helped us with. 2) Housekeeping - after the first night on quite a hard bed, rang housekeeping who came up immediately to put a beautiful down doona on top of the mattress - had the most heavenly sleep -floating on air. They also put a top sheet upon request. Housekeeping who replenish bottles of water everyday and sometimes twice a day as they noted that we drink fair bit of bottled water. Forgot to turn off the "Do not disturb" sign one day and in the afternoon, the room was not made. Saw the housekeeping staff on the floor around 4pm and they came immediately to tidy the room- always smiling, unobtrusive and great service. 3) The friendly shuttle bus driver- the afternoon driver who was a wealth of info about places to eat as we wanted to eat at places where the locals go to ie the best noodles etc 4) the great pool looking onto the mountains - quiet, peaceful and cleaner air than downtown 5) The Restaurant upstairs where we had the Peking duck and other wonderful dishes - reasonable prices - we had the duck( 2 courses) plus 3 other dishes & it was HK 870 for the 3 of us (App Aussie $110). The Hotel's location: Some people were wingeing about the location- the distance to town. If you only have a couple of days in HK and you just want to just shop, then I suggest you stay in town. For us , it was not a problem as we had great fun catching and changing MTR. The Octopus card is a must - get it at the airport. The MTR (5 mins walk from hotel)- one stop south is Sha Tin (5 mins away)- is a huge shopping mall and the next stop is MOng KOk. The other stop north ( from Hotel) is TAI PO - what a great spot - go to the TAI Po markets and then wander around the street stalls ( it is all in a square) - there is a fantastic shop which just sells the best "custard tarts". When u get off MTR at Tai Po , turn left and follow the walkway till the end, cross the road and there is a concrete building - downstairs the market and upstairs the food court. If u want to go to the street stalls and market square, then just keep walking left - follow the people. There is also the free hotel shuttle bus which takes u to town to TSim Tchai Tsui ( 30 - 40 mins) and the schedule times are OK (5 times a day)- first bus at 9.30am -this is fine as most shops do not open till 10.30am or 11am. We usually timed our shopping downtown to catch the bus back -the last bus after dinner or buy some dinner - su shi and catch the earlier bus. On a couple of occasions after a big late lunch , having the canapes for 2 hrs was enough for us. If u miss the hotel bus, just catch the MTR. It was always great to come back from hectic downtown to our quiet oasis. Transport was not a problem with the MTR and the shuttle bus- plus taxis are also very reasonable. WE would always choose this hotel when we come back to HK again. What a great place with fantastic service and incredible staff,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vmessy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after being let down by the Novotel Nathan Road. This hotel is worth every penny. The rooms are large and clean. We had a problem with our first room and within 2 minutes we had another room. The staff make sure you feel welcome and everything about the hotel is great. Free shuttle bus to the Hyatt in TST so saves you metro costs. The metro is close by should you need it and buses are local as well. On the whole a good stay at this hotel, only downside was that i had to pay for the internet and its not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth considering”
Reviews.Author: andycris3107
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by chance a couple of years ago and have used it ever since as my preferred place to stay while in HK. Many people complain about the location and this could be an issue if you plan on spending much time in HK island or Kowloon however if you are planning a trip across the border then this place couldn't be better located. The university MTR station is right outside and takes you direct to the border. In the other direction the famous markets if Mong Kok are only around 10 minutes away with one change at Kowloon Tong station. It will take another change at mong kok to get accross to Central - a total journey time is around 25 minutes. To get here from the airport you can either take a green taxi $250, or the airport shuttle ($100 each) then the same combination of changes. The hotel itself is immaculately clean and very modern. I always select the executive rate available via the Hyatt website as this includes free Internet access, breakfast, and laundry. The cost of these services is expensive by comparison if you pay for them srparately. The breakfast buffet alone is worth it - the quality is amazing. Having stayed in more hotels than I can imagine I have to say that this has one of the best breakfasts out there. My only gripe is that whereas previously they provided freshly made coffee they now provide standard filter coffee only. My only other complaint is the Internet which tends to fluctuate between good and unusable. I had to complain on 3 consecutive days Whig i felt was a let down for the very friendly and helpful staff who did their best but could not fix it. Finally a last word on the location since realistically this is mist likely the only factor to consider. Having been a regular visitor to HK for almost 15 years I can promise you will not find a hotel of comparable cleanliness, friendliness, comfort or class within the same price range any closer to the heart of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous Hyatt, but watch your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: PilotMike2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Shatin in April 2011 for business meetings. This hotel is simply as good as they come -- convenient, clean, safe, comfortable; just about perfect. But, as so often with Hyatts, this comes at a price -- a big, big price. Maybe if I was one of those people traveling on a Fortune 500 expense account, I wouldn't care. But that's not the case for me. So while I enjoy this (and almost all) Hyatts and in this instance it made good business sense, the invoice when you're checking out is eye-popping! Anyhow, other than that, you won't be dissappointed. The facility is new -- maybe just one year old. It's directly connected to the Shatin bus station and the Shatin train station, so transportation is easy. The lobby is modern and spare. The lobby "snack bar" serves a fine breakfast, lunch and dinner, relying on the buffet-style of service but menu options are available. There's a fine business center and a great swimming pool. On the fourth floor there is a bar with live music; they were terrific and my martini was tasty. The chinese restaurant there also provided a better-than-expected hotel dining experience. The rooms (at least, my room) was huge, clean and perfect in every way. Simply nothing, absolutely nothing, to quibble about. The photos show what I mean. Feel free to stay at this Hyatt anytime, as long as your budget can take the hit!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it is good value for money in HK?”
Reviews.Author: BU88LE
Reviews.Content: At around £80 per night (no breakfast), it seemed to be reasonably priced for a four star hotel in HK. The bedroom was not very large but it did have a massive bed. The bathroom was spacious with a shower cubicle, a toilet cubicle, sink, and a tub. Overall a modern and new feel to the room, however, there were marks on the walls and large stains on the carpet. Some tiles in the shower looked worn and the drain was a bit slow. Ate in one of their restaurants (not the buffet) twice. Good food but expensive... And on the subject of money, making local calls was not free, using their computer was not free, tennis court was not free. My favourite thing about the hotel was the pool - it was free! And the staff even provided lounger seat cover and towel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Impeccable Service, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: blandmc
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt Regency in Shatin area of Hong Kong for a few nights. Actually the hotel is gorgeous and luxurious and well matches up to the Hyatt's reputation for exquisite hotels in Asia. I found the service to be exactly the right mix of professional and personable qualities while still trying to offer their guests a measure of privacy and space when needed. The lobby and the rooms are beautiful and look out over the water which provides a great night view, as well. The only drawback is the location. There is absolutely nothing around the hotel. Truly if you need to stay in Shatin area for business and want to stay in a 5-star hotel then this is the place, but don't expect to be able to walk out of your hotel onto the street and walk into shops or restaurants. If that is what you want then there are other options within Shatin though not in the same luxury category. Still - overall a very good experience and if you are content to stay in your hotel while you are here, then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location Is A Bit Out Of The Way”
Reviews.Author: carlgt1
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the many positive reviews here at tripadvisor - as I wanted a more luxurious stay in Hong Kong after spending two weeks in mainland China at, let's say more "spartan" hotels. The facilities, staff, and rooms at the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin are excellent. I booked a full week and found that after a few days I was getting a little sick of the "commute" on the MTR to the downtown sights of Hong Kong. For example, after a day on my feet walking around, on the MTR you can hardly ever get a seat, so the 20-25 minute ride back to the University station next to the Hyatt Sha Tin was a bit grueling after a few days. It's also a little tricky (3-4 changes) to get from the University/East Line to the HK island & Tsim Sha Tsui & Kowloon stops. I often would just take the East Line from University straight to Hung Hom and then just take the nice walk on the harbour to Tsim Sha Tsui etc. But it's a bit out of the way so after coming in for a day to "freshen up" I often didn't feel like heading back out for the night into HK. If you don't mind spending on a taxi for the trips back & forth it may be worth it. I know this isn't the fault of the hotel; but next time I would probably stay in a Hyatt a little closer to town. If I had business at the University or nearby, I would definitely stay at the Hyatt Sha Tin again though.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous. A true 5 star hotel, cannot be faulted. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: MelanieP78
Reviews.Content: A short stay of only 3 days, first time in HK. I cannot say a bad word about this hotel. Research prior to staying indicates the distance from airport, Kowloon, etc. The hotel has a shuttle to Kowloon and the MTR University Station is right next door. Purchase an Octopus card and you are set for unlimited travel on public transport. Trains are crowded but this is all part of the HK experience. The hotel is luxurious, had beds like a cloud, spacious rooms, spacious bathrooms, top-notch food and fabulous service. Early check-in and late check-out accommodated to fit in with flights, cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of nowhere, no free WiFi, taking advantage of a captive audience”
Reviews.Author: XAP
Reviews.Content: To start there were a couple of real ++'s:- -The bathroom was really lovely. Great bath, separate shower, extremely clean, large and well serviced -The room was quiet at night -1 minute walk to University MTR (train station) -Our original room stank of smoke and they quickly moved us to a new room -You get to experience suburban HK OK - now for the not so goods This hotel is MILES AWAY FROM ANYTHING you will want to do as a tourist (or business traveller) in HK. If you were visiting the University it would be good. One of the other reviews said 15mins on a train to town. Um, were they taking the Concorde? The taxi from the Airport (Friday 6.30pm - got a green "new territories" one which is cheaper) cost $260HK and took just over 1/2 hour travelling on average around 100km per hour. When you arrive you will see the university building a tiny 7/11 and 2 student takeaway fast food stores and the hotel - and what you see is what you get. There are no other shops, restaurants, attractions in the local vicinity. If you stay here and you want to see HK (either Kowloon city or the Island), you will need to make the 40minute train trip - changing trains across 4 train lines. We stayed Friday, Saturday and Sunday and travelled at different times including 8am Sunday morning, middle of the day and late evening and we NEVER got a seat on any of the trains because they are always crowded. Not getting a seat isn't such a big deal but it's to illustrate that it's not a leisurely train trip on one line into the city. By the end of the trip you are exhausted and there few places (if any) to sit in public areas (thank goodness for Starbucks) Actually, thank goodness for Starbucks WiFi as well, because the hotel doesn't offer free wifi. When we booked on expedia, the room description said WiFi but, although the hotel offers wifi, you have to pay for EACH DEVICE at a rate of around $25AU per day. This applies in your room and in any other part of the hotel. This is a blatant rip off and you are a totally captive audience because there is not one other available wifi connection point that comes up when you check availability. There is a huge TV in the room but no remote control. Seriously... We rang room service to check if maybe the remote was somewhere we couldn't find it but they confirmed you need to do everything manually Buffet breakfast is $218HK compared with buffet breakfast at the Kowloon Hotel in the middle of Kowloon at $160HK - really it's chalk and cheese. The beds, although made up with lovely linen were extremely hard - not nice hard but to me they felt like layered cardboard. The service was really average. Not terrible and not great. If you are coming to visit HK to see the sites and go shopping this is not the hotel for you. If you are coming to go to the University for some reason this might be an option. We learnt the hard way with this one - a Hyatt at a reasonable price; there had to be a catch and there were many!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 -star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruby5187
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I stayed for years. Great service and quick response on requests. Room was very clean. Great restaurant and bar in the hotel. Walking distance to train station, only about 15 minutes to downtown and 20 minutes to the border. I would strongly recommend this hotel to my freinds travelling to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “convenient comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: remipuri
Reviews.Content: i had the opportunity to stay at the hyatt sha tin with a very large group,about 200 of us,and right from check in to check out,everything went very well.All room keys were ready on time when we checked in,rooms were spacious with all amenities. Breakfast was excellent and catered to international travellers,as a common problem with far east hotels is that the breakfast is predominantly chinese items, which was not the case here.Huge restaurants with very efficient staff,which do not let you feel tables were short for such a large group. The hotel was located right next to a metro and bus station,which was very convenient,as Hong Kong has several night markets and night life areas. The best part was a courtesy coach which operated several times a day to the Tsim Sha Sui shopping district from the hotel and even gave you a transfer back to the hotel several times a day. The whole experience of staying at this hotel was a very pleasant one.The Hyatt is a very reputed chain and they lived up to their reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate experience....”
Reviews.Author: sanChd
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Sha tin stay was a very good experience. The rooms were super clean and well built. Mine provided an excellent view of the harbour. The staff service level was par excellence. The breakfast was well laid to choice and the metro connectivity from University station was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt style”
Reviews.Author: zorbailgreco87
Reviews.Content: Explaining my rates. Really clean, and that's normal for any hotel of this category in a city of this category. Position was kinda cool...really close to public transportations which was extremely useuful for us. No matter if it was in the new territories and not close to the heart of HK, I knew already that very well when booking. Room was very stilish and well organized. Price was awesome for a Hyatt hotel, really! Staff was ok. Just had a problem at checkout when showing my Membership card of Lufthansa and they were totally not knowing what I was asking for. Maybe as there's lots of space, an indoor pool would have been appreciated as the surroundings dont have a lot to offer and for leisure guests would be a good option for making the stay smoother

Reviews.Title: “buffet is so great”
Reviews.Author: bari_ttc
Reviews.Content: This hotel cheaper than other hyatts because of the location. It is close to the train station, however, it still needs 20 mins to travel to the city centre. The buffet is impressive with quality food. Room is typical hyatt style which is always the top! I would recommend this hotel if you are look more at the hotel stars than the location.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: KenWimbledon
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in the New Territories rather than in downtown Kowloon and experience the different surroundings of Sha Tin. The hotel is new, the facilities are excellent, the staff very helpful and travelling into Kowloon on the MTR proved to be very easy. The cost of this additional travel was more than offset by the price of the room which was at least half of what we would have paid for a comparable standard of hotel in Kowloon or on the Island.

Reviews.Title: “A Glorious Mistake”
Reviews.Author: McCann-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: I have to confess I thought I had booked the Hyatt in Tsim Sha Tsui. Yes, I know, a stupid error on my part. however you need a Green Taxi not a Red one and when we arrived I was initially devastated on the location alone.... Once inside our beautiful room and the fabulous views over the river I was beginning to think this was meant to be! We had a great meal in the hotel and the drinks on happy hour, dare I say where very reasonable for Hong Kong. The service in all areas was faultless and we even tried to extend our stay by a night but they were full. We took the train to the local shopping mall and I managed to get one of the best and cheapest haircuts ever whilst my husband enjoyed his best foot massage. Please don't be put off by the location. The Room, Service, Price and Breakfast are incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Sha Tin just wonderful!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MervinCarlo
Reviews.Content: Before boooking at this hotel I have made a lot of research from different websites, and as far as my experience this hotel is fault less. Its only 30 minutes away from the main attractions the train station is adjacent to the hotel even though I'm travelling with young children I did not experience any difficulty in going round hongkong. The hotel rooms are just perfect the twin beds can be slide together w/c is perfect for people with kids, beds are made everyday and every detail is attended to. Shopping mall is 3 stops away, there are plenty of foodstall at the side of the hotel. Overall you can never go wrong with Hyatt, to compensate we even got an upgrade since the pool is being maintained. My whole family love this hotel can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Flawless”
Reviews.Author: MiddleM
Reviews.Content: Nothing surprising about this hotel it was a wonderful. Service, food, swimming pool, gym, rooms, TV channels, bathroom, cleanliness - all spot on. My favourite aspect the breakfast, amazing. Would I stay again? In a heartbeat. If there was any draw back it would be the location, it is miles out of Hong Kong. HOWEVER it is sat on to of an MTR station and getting into town is pretty fuss free and easy. If you're looking to involve yourself in town I would suggest staying nearer the heart of it, if you're on business, a golf weekend, relaxing (in Hong kong seriously?) etc then this may well be the spot for you. Food is exquisite, drinks are well mixed - you do pay the price mind, to be expected anywhere on the island thorugh.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, worth the travel distance from downtown.”
Reviews.Author: edleonguerrero
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, consistent with Hyatt standards. Employees were friendly and knowlegeable. The hotel was literally steps away from the MRT (lightrail line). Although a 20 min train ride away from Tsim Sha Tsui, the Shatin Hyatt provided a nice Western style and size room while room rates were approx. $180 USD per night which included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “out of expectation”
Reviews.Author: little_peg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Sha Tin with my boyfriend during Christmas Hoilday. The location was great. It was just next to University MTR Station. The staff were friendly. The room was very clean and tidy. It also provided free internet access in the room. Although I stayed in the mountain view room, the view was very nice. I could see the heated swimming pool and the lovely garden. This hotel is so excellent that I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel - Location not so spectacular”
Reviews.Author: snasrulla
Reviews.Content: Good: Very well kept hotel, staff is phenomenal. The service received was outstanding. The room was very well maintained, came with a 47" LCD tv and a DVD player. The Hotel also provides DVD's for viewing pleasure at no cost. Room service was always punctual, meals were received hot and very tasty. Regency club (lounge) was a great place to unwind after a long day, great view over the harbour. Breakfast in the club was plentiful and tasty (congee, fruit, cheeses etc)although it was repetitive with little variety offered. Bad: Wireless connectivity a bit spotty at times. There is only one side of the hotel which has a nice view overlooking the harbour, the other side faces the mountain, which isn't much to look at. Ugly: The only item that bothered me was the location. There is absolutely nothing around the hotel area, you essentially need to get on the subway which is however conveniently located steps from the hotel to go anywhere. Overall I would stay at this hotel again. If location is of concern to you and you want to be in the thick of things (ie. HK Island or TST, Mong Kok) then this is not the place to be. It is about a 20 min subway ride to the downtown. However, it is much better kept then the ones downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good wknd getaway from the city”
Reviews.Author: yamachika
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay at the Hyatt regency shatin a couple time a year as it is easy to get to. It is difficult for us to leave hong kong for weekends as work often requires the boyfriend to be on standby. Good for a break from the hustle and bustle of hong kong island, but would NOT recommend this place for visitors looking to tour hong kong. Shatin is quite far from most tourist hot spots. The closest MTR station is "University Station" (not shatin station!). University station is just under an hour away from central station, but you need to change trains twice (I think). The hotel is a 3-5min walk from the station. A taxi from central will cost you around 200 - 250hkd. Positives: - Shatin 18 restaurant. This place has the best Peking Duck I have had in Hong Kong!! - Nice/clean rooms with large bathrooms. - Swimming pool - can lounge by the pool and work on your tan! They now have a poolside bar/restaurant. - Tennis court and cycling. - Close to horse race course. Negatives: - Far from anything... but for us it was a positive!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value 4 stars standard and green location”
Reviews.Author: L00ps
Reviews.Content: Paid just under £100 per night (inc local taxes but ex breakfast - bakery and Maxim's by University Station provided much better value for that) for a KIng Harbour Room which, unsurprisingly, had a huge bed and great views over Tolo Harbour. Lush carpets and large, marbled bathroom with both walk-in shower (big enough for 2) and a bath from which you could see the harbour view through a glass wall. Although the location is out of town, the excellent HK public transport system makes it worthwhile staying at this hotel but do your homework on how the MTR works before you arrive and your experience would be all the better for that. Not advisable to rely on taxis to get to and from the hotel as it is a bit out of the way. University Station on the East Rail overground line is right next door to the hotel (University = The Chinese University of HK). The trains are very quiet so there is no issue with noise. The hotel runs a shuttle bus into Kowloon downtown about 4 times a day. Handy, but probably not frequent enough for some people. Only disappointment about the room was the lack of an armchair. Also, Internet access is very expensive. I was quoted nearly £50 for a week's access!!!!! So in the end I had to make do with paying £7 for an hour's access so that I could check into my flight online. The food was pretty okay but naturally, a bit overpriced comparing to eating out locally (say, take 2 stops on the train to Shatin). Immediately surroundings are very nice with lots of trees and free space i.e. not so built up like downtown. It is possible to take a long walk along the harbour. Shatin racecourse is nearby if you fancy a flutter on the gee gee!

Reviews.Title: “Away from downtown but train station is just nearby”
Reviews.Author: eatshopeatshop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with a trip to Shenzhen in between. Checked in at about 2 pm for the first night but was told room was not ready. Decided to walk to the University metro station and had lunch at Maxim's, a local fast food chain selling local specialties, including dim sum. (This was where i settled my breakfast over the next few days due to the variety of food here and the rate i paid did not include breakfast.) Asked the concierge again an hour later and was given a suite with harbour view, probably due to Platinum status. Went to Shenzhen for 1 night and on return, was given a normal room this time round. Both rooms were what one would expect in a Hyatt room or suite, so absolutely no complaints. As for location, the hotel is away from the main shopping places like Kowloon and Tsim Sha Tsui, it takes about 40 minutes from University station where the hotel is to get to downtown. On the other hand, it is closed to Shenzhen border and offers a good option for any traveller who wants to get to Shenzhen for a day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Service”
Reviews.Author: Snydly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little way out of Hong Kong proper, but the MTR is next door makes downtown Hong Kong only a 20 minute ride away. The staff made the distance worthwhile. We were given first class service in every aspect of our stay. The hotel and the rooms were beautiful and very well equiped. Just be sure if you have just arrived in Hong Kong, to have Hong Kong money to pay for the cab.

Reviews.Title: “It's a "PERFECT" hotel to stay and it's really not that far, we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: dj_rbjslimm
Reviews.Content: We were checked in here for 6 days and 5 nights. My girlfriend came a day earlier (Tuesday) and was shocked when it took her more than 1 hour to get to the hotel from the airport. I told her to take the A41 bus going to Sha Tin's New Town Plaza bus terminal and then take the train ride on the way to Lo Wu's direction and take off at the University station. At first she was furious with the hassle that she went through considering that he luggage was quite big, she even called me up and told me don't be surprsied if it will take me more than 1 hour to reach the hotel. She also told me it's on a different side of Hong Kong compared to Kowloon, TST or Central for that matter. But that's the thing, i chose this hotel for a difrerent experience, away from the city's usual noise and crowded streets, a good place where you can relax, unwind and just chill. And from the photos, I knew this was a perfect place to spend some quality time with my girlfriend. I came in early Wednesday. By 12 noon I was already in the hotel. Man, I have to say, I'm impressed with thye location, the moment i reached the hotel's vicinity, right there I knew this was a "steal" and I felt we made the right choice when we booked this hotel in the first place. Hotel Lobby - Perfect Reception People - Perfect Location - Perfect as well! (it's 2-3 mins walk from the University Station MTR) Room - Excellent! (set up was great and the room is quite big) I know if you're new to Hong Kong like it's your first time to visit and when you see some of the reviews about this hotel, you might worry a little but I guarantee you this hotel is "off the hook". It's really not that far and it's actually convenient since it's right beside an MTR station, so basically from the hotel you can go anywhere in Hong Kong from this point. There's also a "Huge" mall (New Town Plaza) near the hotel (2 MTR stations away only). And the mall is good too. Overall, This hotel is almost PERFECT in my book, the only downside w/c is not really a big deal is the internet. It's not free. Some tips that might help: - From the airport, don't take a cab, the price is not worth it, take the bus A41 which will drop you off at Sha Tin's New Town Plaza ($21 HKD) And take the escalator going inside the mall and then go to the MTR station connected to the mall (Sha Tin Station) then pay $4 HKD for a ticket and take the train going to Lo Wu, 2 stops only, Fo Tan and University where the hotel is located, so it's that easy. - No food stalls, just some small eateries and 711. But the mall is near so it's cool, you can take the MTR and its fast so no worries, they also have restos there like 3 or 4 i think, and they serve good food too. It's Hyatt so you'll never go wrong and quality is at it's BEST. We had a breakfast buffet for $457 HKD for 2 and it's worth it. - From hotel to New Town Plaza, Sha Tin Mall, if you will take a cab, it wil cost you around $60 - $70 HKD. I'll post some pics later. We had a blast staying in Hyatt Sha Tin, very romantic place indeed. 5 stars and 2-Thumbs up for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, very good value”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTortuga
Reviews.Content: It's true that this hotel is pretty far from Hong Kong's big attractions, but I'd stay there again, no question. It felt like a much more expensive hotel than it was. I liked the layout of my room a lot, and the staff was very helpful. I had a great view of Tolo Harbour. The pool was nice. One suggestion I have is to take advantage of the attractions near the hotel. For example, take the ferry that leaves from Ma Liu Shui, which you can walk to, out to Tap Sun and see the fishing villages along the way. The round trip takes about 3 1/2 hours, and you'll feel like you're a hundred miles from the big city. It cost about $7 U.S. total to go out and back. You pay each way. Also, I enjoyed walking through the Chinese University of Hong Kong's campus the mornings I was there. Go at dawn when the bird life is bustling, especially near the ponds, which are near the University MTR station. Breakfast at the student canteen isn't bad at all, and you can buy half the menu for what the breakfast buffet costs at the hotel. I would have spent more money at the hotel if the Internet charge ($20 U.S.) and the buffets ($28 U.S. for breakfast and a good bit higher for lunch and dinner) hadn't been so pricey. The cheapest way I know to get to the hotel from the airport is to take a bus such as Route A41 for $21 H.K., exact amount required, to Sha Tin Center, and switch to the MTR train that goes in the direction of Lo Wu, getting off at the University station. That costs $4 H.K. Get off the train, and if you can't see the Hyatt when you leave the station, go to the other side of the station and you will. It's a short walk to the hotel, and you'll want to enter on the car park level to save walking all the way up the incline to reach the lobby. The bus/train combination will work if you don't have much luggage. I had a hand bag and a rollerboard and did fine. The bus, which has a sizable luggage rack on its lower level, is a straight shot to Sha Tin Center, and after you get off, go up the escalator and ask someone to point you in the direction of the MTR station. If you're on a schedule, leave plenty of time to switch between train and bus, because it can be confusing getting from the bus to the train. It doesn't cost a whole lot to take the Hyatt bus straight from the airport to the hotel, which would be a good idea if you have a heavy suitcase. After my stay at the Hyatt Sha Tin, I spent one night at the SkyCity Marriott on the airport grounds, and it was nice enough but was a bit of a letdown compared to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern comfortable hotel, great bathroom, good food,good service,expensive internet.”
Reviews.Author: ForeverTravelfan
Reviews.Content: We took a harbour view room. Modern hotel, style is different from other 4 and 5 stars hotels. Perfect bathroom, very good shower, great service, walking distance (2 minutes) to Metro Station University East Rail Line. But away from center of HK. For us, good choice, we came from Shenzhen and that is not so far away. Very good breakfast (large choice, even cheese) and very good dinner (buffet), prices of buffet and for sure of wines rather high (cheapest is 65 HK dollar for 1 glass Italian wine), but the buffet was really very good (wide choice of food: Japanese, Chinese, European....even they make fresh wafles with fresh strawberries....) Our stay was unfortunately too short...1 last night before our departure to Belgium. Very expensive internet fare: 80 HK dollars (8€ for 1 hour!)

Reviews.Title: “Virtually Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DaSaint
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The long stay rooms on the upper floors are very spacious, well equipped with excellent showers and a bath, a nice living area with a separate toilet, very large tv's, a DVD player, fridge and it goes on. On a negative side although the main bed was large, it was a bit too firm I thought. The gym and swimming pool were great, service was excellent but the meals were a bit expensive but very good quality, preparation and service. It's not located in central Hong Kong but that's a plus not a negative as it's a quieter area unlike Kowloon and transport is easy using the subway right next to the hotel or taking a taxi. The spa was okay but their advertised service for kids was a waste of money. Otherwise it was fantastic. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, easy go to downtown mainland”
Reviews.Author: wilsonjing
Reviews.Content: Although many people said not easy to go to Kowloon, but I am pretty familiar with Hong Kong, go there like 3 times a month. Quiet place, and the janitor even said good afternoon to me, even I am a Chinese, front desk is polite, and the bellboy in the lobby. Can have a baht with your love one and watch big TV will go there in September

Reviews.Title: “Everything from check-in check-out stay was just a breeze”
Reviews.Author: ArunBhaskar
Reviews.Content: Though the Hotel is bit far from the city centre but it is well connected by MTR i.e. University station. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel wnd would love to go there again. The staff is well versed in English. The stay can be described as damn cool. Even there was New Town Plaza a mall nearby just two MTR stations away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but hotel needs improvement on details”
Reviews.Author: ahlolo34
Reviews.Content: Was looking to stay at a hotel without leaving HK. Hyatt Sha Tin was a great choice. I'd like to begin by saying that the hotel is obviously situated for the convenience of vacation seekers who want to stay at a hotel in the countryside or business people visiting offices nearby such as Tai Po Industrial Estate, Chinese University or Sha Tin. It is obviously not for those who wants to tour around Hong Kong. Statements saying the hotel is too far from the city doesn't do the hotel justice. Also, for the mountain view rooms, be prepared to be disturbed occasionally by the passing East Rail despite the very good sound insulation. I think this is something that should be expected as the hotel is so conveniently located near the University station. That said, I requested early check in for a non-smoking room and received confirmation for 2 p.m. early check in. I attempted check in before 2p.m. and was assigned a room on the 7th floor (non-smoking floor). With two bags of belongings, I was asked to go to the room without any assistance offered to handle the luggage. I tried not to jump to any premature conclusions about the hotel. When I walked into the room, it smelled so bad that I thought it was a smoking room. So I requested a change of the room. None were immediately available and I had to wait until 3p.m. (the usual check in time). I was then assigned to a room on 11th floor. The room was even bigger than the original one but the staff didn't tell me anything about an upgrade which I found very odd as an upgrade would have indicated that they tried to compensate for the trouble they had caused.
