Anyhow, the room was great, clean and spacious. However, what the staff had forgotten was to install a DVD player at the new room that I had initially requested for my original room. I didn't bother to ask as I did not want to deal with yet another problem. Tried the Cafe for lunch and food can be improved in every department. Quantity was abundant but quality could have been better. The Patisserie (cake shop) was excellent from food to service. The seating area could be a bit bigger. Went for a spa session and the service and quality is very good. The spa suite was very spacious and quite comfortable. Unfortunately, the spa is not connected to the steam and jacuzzi located in the changing rooms by the swimming pool and the gym. The gym is great for a hotel. The equipment is very new and trains all the major muscle groups. The staff were again very friendly and helpful. After closure of the pool for 2 days during the typhoon Chuntha and thunderstorm warnings, finally checked it out on the morning before my departure. The changing room's jacuzzi was broken down for who knows how long and the changing room in general was not of 5 star quality. When I arrived at the swimming pool, I asked for water and was told by the friendly lifeguard that it was only available back in the changing room 1 floor above the pool in a water dispensing machine?!?! The outdoor bar area by the pool was still under ongoing renovation. So I laid down on the sun bed for about 10 minutes and received about 10 mosquito bites. There seemed to be no or seriously lacking mosquito control measures by the pool. The pool area was the most unacceptable part of the hotel. While taking a shower in my room after the dip at around 1:45p.m., I received a call from reception asking when I was going to check out. I was freezing as I was in the middle of a shower and had to answer the call at the toilet. I was left a bit puzzled as I specifically requested 2p.m. check out at the time I checked into the hotel. The receptionist then put me on hold to check availability which made sure I remained freezing. At the end, she confirmed 2p.m. check out was available. So, much trouble was caused to the guest but could have been absolutely avoided. Based on the aforesaid, I think there are pros and cons to this hotel with the former outweighing the latter. I believe the friendly staff has to do a lot with this which leaves me to conclude that the problems I had experienced are at the management level and not how the general staff have poorly executed service of the guests. I will be sure to revisit the Patisserie.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazygal
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for our vacation in Hong Kong. My husband and I were impressed by the knowledgeable staff who worked to meet all our needs. The room was very large and the bathroom was clean and tidy. We were able to use the pool everyday. It was a very peaceful hotel to stay at and we would recommend the hotel to everyone. Our only complaint would be the location. It is located a little bit far away from all the main attractions in Hong Kong. But with the MTR located right by the hotel, you can hop on the metro and go anywhere quite quickly. So if you don't mind a hotel that is a little out of the way...you will enjoy this Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Its a really nice hotel - but far from city”
Reviews.Author: Dori-DD
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel as we got a very good deal during the New year and also because we liked the rooms. We knew that the hotel was located outside the city centre. We went to the Hyatt Regency counter at the airport and we were taken in a bus to the hotel. It took us about 45 mins to get to the hotel. There was actually a queue at the reception! We finally got our room and it had a nice view. The rooms were spacious and the bed was very comfortable. There is a metro station right next to the hotel and although the hotel is not located in the centre of the city, we did not have any major problems. However, the metros close at 2300 hrs and after that we had to take taxis back to the hotel - and they were quite expensive. The breakfast was not so bad - though it was kind of repetitive. The staff were ok - some quite impersonal. We also ordered room service and the food was quite good. We will stay at this hotel again - although location is a bit of a problem, esp. if you travel during the night.

Reviews.Title: “it's far from city center, but it's worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: designative
Reviews.Content: we got this hotel on the last minute before Chinese New Year. The hotel is a bit far from the main attractions, but even though it was worth. Hyatt is Hyatt, don't need to say much: we got an upgrade, huge room, great staff. I highly recommend try their room service. Good food and, not expensive for Hyatt standard. I will definitely stay in that hotel when I travel back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Sha Tin”
Reviews.Author: AMac235
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is located pretty much on University Station (Blue Line). If you look at a map of the MTR, you should see that this is NOT in downtown Hong Kong. It was about 30-40 minutes to go University Station to TST via the Blue -> Purple Lines. Not the best place to be if you want to experience everything in Kowloon or Hong Kong Island. That said, this hotel was every I needed it to be and more for a visit to CUHK. The staff was very professional and helpful with travel arrangements, suggestions on places to go and accommodating all of my needs. Breakfast in the morning had a good mix of traditional foods as well as Western options. Fitness set was immaculate and well staffed. I definitely felt like I had my own private fitness club. The rooms are as they look on the website. Very modern with a comfortable bed with plenty of space to spread out. There were two of us in a King room and we were able to survive a week without getting in each others way. The rooms are spacious by Hong Kong standards. Bathroom had 1 sink with some counter space, a soaking whirlpool tub, a rainfall shower with massage head and a separated toilet area. Housekeeping was superb with water service in the evening. Room service was solid. If you need to be in the Sha Tin area, this is the place you should stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.. FAR AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: mauiguys
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel on our HK / Macau trip. Overall loved the hotel and originally thought it would be nice to be "out of the city" but wish we had stayed longer at Hyatt TST. The hotel itself was great and the actual room was more plush than TST, it was just a little farther that we thought it would be. Don't get me wrong, it's very convenient to the Subway, the station is only a five minute walk out of the hotel and you can't get lost. It just takes about 45 minutes to get to TST and almost an hour to HK island. Can't fault anything about the hotel though. Top notch! The only reason I wouldn't recommend is the location. Sorry :( By the way.. The buffet at dinner is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: GoldieMumbai
Reviews.Content: HYATT- as the brand says this hotel indeed is. Get airport shuttle at very reasonable rates, easy to find counter at airport, nice rooms and everything that you find in 5 star. This may be 7 star!! Overall the best hotel your money can buy in hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary customer care goes a long way.”
Reviews.Author: hanam0geraed
Reviews.Content: We were slightly wary of going for a relatively new hotel for our HK stay, but after reading many positive reviews here we decided to go for it and I'm very pleased we did. The hotel is in Shatin but is near the University, and as such is pretty much in the middle of nowhere and not near any shops bar a little 7-Eleven and fast food place which is near the overground train station. Because of this, first-time visitors/tourists may prefer something closer to town centres but for us the location was perfect as it was quiet (despite being next to the train station! It was inaudible to us when inside), had good transport links with the station and bus terminal next door, and was one stop away from where most of my family live. Also being new and not ideally placed means that their rates are lower than equivalent hotels in more convenient locations. The staff here are really attentive and helpful. No one just stands around chatting, or if they are talking to colleagues they'll leap into action as soon as they see any guests around. As soon as our taxi arrived at the hotel a bellhop came out before it had even come to a stand-still. After checking in we did find that they had omitted a third bed for our room although we had booked a twin room for 3, and also the sliding bathroom door did not slide properly. A quick word with the reception and within 20 minutes both problems were sorted without any fuss whatsoever. Whether you're after a newspaper, an ironing board or random bits of cutlery just ask and it'll be in your room within the next minute; it may even beat you to your room as we found! The room itself wasn't huge but enough for 3 people, and if it was just 2 people occupying it as it was designed then it would be ample space. It was kept really clean apart from some tea stains near the kettle. The beds were comfortable, including the smaller added bed. However the duvets were too warm, especially for the warmer months, and we had to crank the air conditioning right up which is not very green. We didn't really use much in the way of extra services so can't comment. The pool there is a nice size and with the hotel being quite empty when we went, there was no fighting for space whatever the time of day. There is wired and wireless broadband offered for all rooms but this is a complete rip-off as expected - HKD85 for one day or HKD230 for more extended use. You would be better off finding a McDonald's and using the free wi-fi there which is what we chose to do! Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt, and given all of its positive points I would definitely stay there again. After staying there I was emailed a questionnaire about how we found our stay. I fed back any issues that we experienced, and within the next 24 hours I was emailed back by a manager thanking me and running through all the points I made, saying they would be passed on to the relevant parties. Nice to know that someone actually reads them all! Some random info for anyone thinking of staying there: To get to shops/restaurants it's only 10-15 minutes to the nearest town centre by train, so the location of the hotel doesn't have to deter. Tai Po Market is one stop away, and Shatin two. Shatin centre is a bit more upmarket and more of a mall, but beware as it gets crazy (think sardines) in the evenings and especially at weekends, public holidays or even if there's sales on in the department store. Tai Po is not especially tailored to tourists and there isn't much English around, but if you don't mind the odd mystery dish there's plenty of culinary gems around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money hotel - poor location but not a problem with excellent transport”
Reviews.Author: ramin3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hyatt Regency for 1 week. The service was excellent and prices to match. Rooms were big by Hong Kong standard and everything felt new and clean. The location is not great but given the excellent public transport, it only took 20/25mins to reach Kowloon and Hong Kong Island which is super (air conditioned!). The staff were very nice and always their to help. The swimming pool was great as well but not quiet up to a 5* rating. The in-house spa treatment was top notch! Overall, a great 5* hotel and people on a budget should seriously consider this.

Reviews.Title: “NEW AND EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Mohit15
Reviews.Content: Very good location and beautiful view from the Mountain View Room Must Stay well connected with the Univercity Metro Station

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Sha Tin Great Place To Be Stranded”
Reviews.Author: flounder1234
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Hong Kong due to Volcanic Ash disrupting flights. There were few hotels available, luckily the Hyatt was one of them. After spending 2 nights in the Ramada Hong Kong the Hyatt was a breath of fresh air. We originally booked 4 nights at a cheap internet rate and the hotel allowed us to extend our stay if needed at this same rate. However we managed to get a flight home after 3 nights and the hotel allowed us to cancel at short notice with no surcharges. Reception staff were polite, courteous and efficiant, as were all staff in fact. The room was large for Hong Kong standards and spotlessly clean. Mountain View room had all the amenities with a good view over the hills. Good selection of bars and restaurants in the hotel with high quality food. Excellent business centre, pool and fitness room. Location is a short walk from University MTR station so its cheap and easy to get around. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hyatt sha tin”
Reviews.Author: q8-75
Reviews.Content: good location near the MTR just 100 m from the hotel so u can go in an easy way around HK the room is clean with space we had room with harbour view the view was fantastic the restaurant was buffet or order good food with good price the staff were friendly the consierg staff were very helpful they were going the extra mile

Reviews.Title: “luxury in shatin”
Reviews.Author: yuki-ukko
Reviews.Content: we were lucky enough to stay in a large spacious 2 bedroom suite with living room/kitchen with an awesome view of the sea and ma on shan, we easily made this place home in no time.....staff here were super friendly and always able to answer all our queries, even at 4am in the morning and room service was speedy and nicely served up. As it was within walking distance from the train station, it was easy for us to travel to nearby towns and grab food, shopping and sight seeing.....plus a taxi ride from lan kwong fong at 3am costed no more than HK$160, cheap compared to other cities in the world for the distance travelled or you could go check out the nightlife in nearby towns, with "after five" in tai po getting a special mention due to its cheap drinks and friendly staff and only HK$55 taxi ride home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice break from HK”
Reviews.Author: Muiriel77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now. Once in Nov09 and once in Feb10. It takes about an hour or an hour and a half to get there from HK island by MTR but it feels like you are somewhere totally different when you arrive. The air is so much cleaner. We hired bikes both times from the hotel and cycled along the Tolo harbour which is great. The spa is nice too and the exec level is great with nice food selections in the evening along with Cava. The bed is a bit hard for my liking but everything else was generally very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer51
Reviews.Content: Although this Hotel is a long way from the "action" of Hong Kong, it is very near to a Train Station so travelling to other areas is very easy. It is a new Hotel, the standard was very good. I was given a very small room at the back of the Hotel but some of my colleagues had lovely rooms facing the water. Luck of the draw when you are on a Conference.

Reviews.Title: “I read reviews”
Reviews.Author: BEFAIR_10
Reviews.Content: reviews are great. I really liked the regency club and room I booked at this hotel. Neat comfortable bedding, a couch,coffee table, desk, and great bathroom. I loved it and paying whatever little extra it was for the "regency club" gave us the breakfasts and cocktail appetisers everyday making the outtings each day straight to the point without worries of eatting somewhere until we got hungry. I'm sure that was a valuable addition to our happy visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Hit & Miss”
Reviews.Author: daijobu
Reviews.Content: Booked a Regency Club room via the Hyatt Gold Passport website and requested DVD player and late check-out. Within a day, an e-mail was sent to me noting the DVD player and type of bedding requested were confirmed. Upon arrival at the street-level check-in counter, I was adviced that Regency Club room guests have a dedicated counter in the Club Lounge for an exclusive check-in so a very polite member of their staff escorted me up to the 25th floor for just that. By the time we arrived at the Club check-in desk, I was informed that my room is ready, and a brief overview of my stay and requests was given, including the complimentary evening cocktails being served at the lounge (which was ending mid-way during the overlong check-in process). I mentioned my request for late check-out, and the staff frowned and told me I need to request for late check-out ahead of time, which I pointed out I had during booking. He then proceeded to check on his computer, and a few minutes later he seemed to have finally located the information to that request, to which he then told me, "well, it's a policy that late check-out can only be given when it's available... the hotel is fully booked...(blah)." In any case, I just asked for my key and I headed to the room, which was located almost as far away from the elevator as possible, and for some strange reason the room has a room within a room which is occupied by a dining table and chairs surrounded by sliding wood panels. I guess I just didn't think this was something I needed for the night, so I called the concierge to see about a room-change. Little did I know that it would be 30 minutes and 3 calls for me to actually get to speak to the concierge - all the while I kept getting the operator saying,'I'll have them call you back right away." (which they never did) 45 minutes have passed and a hotel staff comes by and escorts me to a new room. What I thought was a very nice gesture to make up for the long check-in (and the poser attitude from the check-in staff), and amenities I didn't care for, turned out to be a bigger room with unflushed toilets and water leaks that nearly earned me a trip to the hospital. There is a separate bathroom in the living room, and as I put down my bags and said goodbye to the hotel staff [who escorted me to the upgraded one-bedroom], I walked around the new room and thought this was a really nice place. I began to unpack and tried to get my laptop connected to check e-mail. Had a little trouble getting the broadband connection - there was no instructions to be found in the desk drawers. In any case, this was resolved after 10 minutes or so. I got up and walked out to the living room and as I headed toward the "guest" bathroom, my legs went up into the air and my back landed on my luggage, which I had left behind me. As I put my hands down to lift my body up, I realized I had slipped on a puddle of water. I looked up and there went a trickle right down onto my face - the leak was from above. I grabbed a towel that was hanging in the bathroom and put it over the puddle, and threw some tissue on-top to soak up the water. Having no bin to throw the tissue away, I lifted the lid to the toilet [thinking to dispose the tissue] and realized that whoever used it before did not flush, and there were "remains" left behind from the previous patron. Furious at all that has happened in the past hour, to which I felt like I was paying to do work for the hotel, I called "guest services" again. They assured me someone would come right away... Another 15 minutes went by, the phone rang and the operator told me I need to open the door so the repairmen could come in. I asked why they didn't just knock at the door, to which I was told coldly that I had the "do not disturb" sign on. I have never heard of that kind of strict courtesy -- so does that mean if a fire broke out, they would still respect my privacy?! 15 minutes after the repairmen entered, they managed to fix the leak. Before they left, they told me House Keeping would be coming to clean up -- as of check-out the next day, no one ever called or came by. I guess my luck just ran out that day at the Hyatt Shatin, but I wouldn't expect that level of service, or lackthereof, even with a Motel 6 -- adding more insult to injury, when I informed the lady during check-out, she responded by saying, "is there anything I could do for you right now?" I decided it was just a waste of my time to even comment - I never expected to pay my way so I can be treated as a custodian by the Hyatt group.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: nerdyprof
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The rooms were spacious, spotless, modern, stylish, and well appointed. I came to Hong Kong on a business trip and was a bit put off by having to stay out in the middle of nowhere, but one look at the room changed my mind. I really enjoyed the room, but the breakfasts, the fitness center, and the restaurant were all great as well. Big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTripPerson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks with several young children while I was visiting my parents. Overall an excellent value for the money; I'd definitely recommend this hotel. Extended-stay suites were very spacious with beautiful views; staff were quite helpful and friendly. Lots of nice amenities for extended-stay travelers--wonderful fitness center, heated saltwater pool with a large shallow end for kids, playground on site, free DVD selection in business center, discounts for longer-term guests on hotel services. Close proximity to MTR station makes getting to other sights in the city relatively painless, even with several children. Only downsides were higher than normal Internet fees and a hotel air circulation system that would occasionally leave unusual scents in our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, need some help at check in”
Reviews.Author: busytraveler84
Reviews.Content: I justed stayed at this hotel for the first time. Hotel is very nice and facilities you would expect with a Hyatt. Location is ok. Nothing in the area to do. The MTR station is right out the door. The only issue with this hotel is the headache I went through at check in. I arrived at 2PM and had reserved a King non smoking room and I am a GP Platinum member. First they wanted to put in a twin room, after I told them no, then they wanted to put me in a King smoking room. Again I said no. They said give us 1hr and we will have a room. Ok, where can I go for the next hour. They made no effort to even apologize or say go the bar and have a drink on us while you wait. Other hotels that I have been to of the same level at least have the common courtesy to try to make you comfortable while you wait. I came back after 1hr and they still did not have room. They checked some more and then gave me a king non smoking room. I went up to the room and it stunk of smoke. This was clearly not a non smoking room. I called the front desk and it took them about 1 hour to find me a room. The hotel moved me to a suite. This was unexpected, but nice. I have to say it was one of the strangest suites I have been in. The living room area is rather large, but has almost no furniture. The sofa is very uncomfortable. The rest of the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Is just a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sergio_Claver
Reviews.Content: Ok this is a 5 star hotel The basics are normal, fitness center, swimming pool, commom areas. One plus could be the scenary but is not something spectacular. The Top: -If you dont have much lugagge then you can take the metro and get down in the university station, from there is just in the front. (be aware that this train goes just until 23:00 or around) - One very important fact: If you want to go to shenzhen to make shopping then this hotel is very handly as when returning from shenzhen and crossing to hong kong you have to take the same metro that has the stop in front of the hotel (university station) - You get peace as is not in the center. - The scenary is good. The bad: - If you take the metro then you will have to enter by the parking door, and then take the lift, as the lobby has a direct access just for cars and taxis. - No breakfast included Overall is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a very different hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: sakuraimidori
Reviews.Content: I have been to the city couple times before. But this hotel is really different from where I stayed. Although it is not located in the business districts, it takes only 30minutes to reach the hotel from the airport, just as convenient as those hotels on the HK island. The natural surroundings were fabulous! The air, the breeze, the scenery were fresh. You could see the motion of trees and waves. The atmosphere was just so soothing that made me totally relaxed. The staff there are helpful and friendly as well. They wore a warm smile whenever I met them. I really appreciate this. The room was spacious and comfortable, not the luxurious type though. The oversized window allow the stunning views of Tolo Harbour to flood in. I am really impressed by the staff and atomsphere of this hotel. I will definely visit again during my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Ahbear62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 24 days in total while in Hong Kong visiting relatives. When we first entered our suite we were all in awe. There was a large spacious sitting room with a kitchenette area that had every thing apart from a cooker; a dining table and chairs; comfy sofas and a breath-taking sea view. The two bedrooms had ample room to sleep the five of us in and the best thing was that there were plasma tvs in all the rooms so no fighting over the remote. The staff were excellent - efficient and helpful. I have been informed that the hotel is a training hotel for the university students so you can expect good service. Transportation was not a problem as the MRT station, which was a 3-5 minute walk away from the hotel, has frequent trains to take you towards the New Territories or Kowloon/Hong Kong Island direction. We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Packthatbag
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, so easy to get to from the airport, and MRT to downtown Kowloon on the doorstep. Also so close to go to Shenzen, China for the day for some serious shopping. The Regency Lounge facilities were just wonderful and well worth the upgrade to include breakfast and cocktails. Swimming pool and kids club are perfect. A brand new hotel, expect some luxury, this hotel upholds the Hyatt brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: emsy85
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. friendly staff and nice location. Terrace good. Would stay again if on business.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay, just like home.”
Reviews.Author: travel-xp
Reviews.Content: I went with my family to Hong Kong for a week. We stayed for a week and were extremely satisfied with what we have gotten. The staff were courteous and helpful when we asked for assistance. The room was comfortable and we were pleasantly surprised the moment we checked into the room. It was spanking clean and bright. The hotel is some half hour away from the airport and there is a train station nearby. Transport wise, it is convenient though the station (University) is some distance away from Hong Kong island and you'll need more than half an hour to get there. We heard that the lunch buffet from our friends was nice though we did not try as we were out of the hotel early on all the days we were there. We will definitely try it the next time we are there. I like the gym and the equipment are new as well. It's good for one who would like to have a workout during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value if you don't need to stay in the city center”
Reviews.Author: jpatokal
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is an excellent brand new hotel that would easily cost you twice as much if it was more centrally located. Which is not to say it's hard to get to: it's right outside the University MTR station (~20 min from TST), just take Exit B, turn your head right and you'll see the Hyatt sign, although the pedestrian entrance is via the car park and partly hidden by the construction site next door. Despite having no Hyatt status and booking a cheap prepaid weekend rate, I was bumped up into an enormous "Deluxe King" complete with sofa, bathtub, oodles of space and great views of the green hills behind the hotel -- quite different from your average HK hotel window! Tea/coffee and nibbles were free, and if you're not in the mood for hotel food, there's a 7/11, a bakery and a Maxim MX Chinese fast food eatery at the station. If it's your first time as a tourist in HK or you've got business on the Island, this probably isn't the best choice for you. But if you're a repeater, going to the University, or planning to explore the New Territories, the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin is great on all counts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new Hyatt in Hong Kong, nice room with fantastic views.”
Reviews.Author: FC1123
Reviews.Content: Hotel was still not fully opened during my stay, however, great room and courteous staff made me feel at home. Very convenience for transportation, walking distance to the train.

Reviews.Title: “A very classy Hotel with fabulous staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Grayza23
Reviews.Content: This is a super classy hotel with some of the friendliest and most helful staff I have encountered! The rooms are very luxurious, with a range of stunning amenities, and the views are superb. Transport to the city centre is adjacent to the hotel, and obviously the rail network in HK is as efficient as anywhere in the world. We had a wonderful stay, and could not recommend this hotel more highly!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: amfaalil
Reviews.Content: I Have staye in the hotel for 5 days for the first time in Hong kong it was very good hotel in hong kong it was very beautiful.the stay was very good and peacefull.i liked staying there.it is perfect spot to stay for holidays.staying there was veryyyy good....

Reviews.Title: “Nice--but no way is this a five-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrGoldin
Reviews.Content: Everyone is calling this new baby a five-star hotel in the making, and I have to disagree. First, it is absurdly difficult to get to the hotel on foot, and for that reason alone I would never recommend it. (Nor does the hotel do very much in the way of posting signs for the benefit of pedestrians or travelers coming from the nearby MTR station.) When you do finally make your way there, you find that you're entering the building along the access lanes for the parking garage. That's hardly a grand entrance. The whole message is "Anyone worthwhile will surely be arriving by car or taxi; people who want to walk in off the street must be vagabonds." Next, I never could figure out the air conditioning controls in my room, and suspect that the whole system was faulty. The default temperature setting is 20 degrees Celsius, but the room was never that cold. I had to bring it down to 19.5 or 19--and even then it didn't seem to work properly, in that the fan would go for hours and hours without cooling the room significantly, and then suddenly and unpredictably start blasting air so frigid that you'd have to run to the thermostat and raise the temperature again. Not very comfortable. The room design is intelligent; you get a nice bed, wired internet access (150 RMB for 24 hours), and a spacious bathroom with separate bath and shower. My soap dish had a layer or two of soap scum that the chambermaid never managed to clean, and initially I was missing my bathroom scale. (I didn't even know the room was supposed to include a scale until I asked for one because I needed to weigh my bags for my flight the next morning.) Be prepared to hear the MTR trains running all night. All in all, I'd have to say you'd probably be better off somewhere else. It's not as though there aren't many good hotels in Hong Kong to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mickiburns
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin prior to competing in a triathlon in the area. We arrived via the KCR and rode our bike over to the hotel. The hotel is less than 400 meters from the University train station. We typically stay in Central or Kowloon when traveling to Hong Kong, but opted for a room in the New Territories because of its proximity to the race. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the service was superb. The staff was so friendly and accommodating that we felt like royalty. We could not have asked for better treatment. The rooms in the hotel were spacious, clean and modern. We had a lovely view of the harbor. The bathroom was large and fresh. The restaurant served delicious food and again the service was definitely five stars. Despite a busy mother’s day crowd, the staff attended to every detail. We felt as if we were on a vacation rather than simply visiting Hong Kong for an evening. We plan to return soon, and given the ease of public transportation in Hong Kong and the beautiful and quiet surroundings of the hotel, I am certain we will be back in the New Territories.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: swisscook2001
Reviews.Content: We arrrived at the Hotel from the Hong Kong Airport - it is directly located at the University Station on the East Rail Line. If you don't have too much luggage it is no problem taking the MTR but with a few suitcases it might be. The Hotel itself is very nice and brand new. Rooms are very spacious, clean & bright. The Regency Club Floor is very nice and has a great Patio attached to the Lounge where you can enjoy your Drinks & Snacks. Great View onto the Harbour. Staff has been very helpful and friendly during our visit. Also has a great Outdoor Pool and other facilities. All in all exellent value for Money - it does take you around 20min to take the MTR to get to Kowloon and around 30 min to get to Hong Kong. But to me the Hotel was well worth the travel.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectation Hyatt Hong Kong Experience Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Charles__222
Reviews.Content: Upon entrance, like all hotels in HK, a warm welcome by the door staff, which is appreciated as always, since I travel a lot, so any feeling of uneasiness does not help, and they have done well again on that. Having been many Hyatts around the globe, this is definately a new experience in some ways. It's grand, it's definately at a very comfy price range (I travel for my own business, so a little price-cut with a little more luxury is always welcomed). After I got myself checked in, went to my room on the 15th floor, got a sea view room, which was relaxing upon arrival. You get your luxuries such as a big LCD screen for TV purposes, a king size bed, nice bathroom with a window with an individual shower compartment. Im gonna bring my lady here next time definately!!! (It's got a window so the bath is viewable to the room!!!) Jokes aside, everything seems very adequate, the kind of service that you would expect will meet your expectations or even exceed it. I remembered having visited Hyatts in UK specifically, in comparison between the two, i would definately say this one in Shatin is a winner amongst many Hyatts that I have been to. Shame that I'm not a photo person, but when I do re-visit with my misses, she will bring a camera along and I'll ask her to upload the shots for you all.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Sha Tin - one of a kind in Sha Tin”
Reviews.Author: joannejoy9289
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Sha Tin offers excellent facilities. Though the hotel is still in it's soft opening, I see that the facilities to be offered would be very much competitive to other five star hotels in HK. Staff are warm and friendly. The location is quite far though for leisure trips to HK. Good staff and excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonandKatie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt from 4/12 to 4/14. The hotel is a new hotel that was recently opened in February. It is so new that they have yet to have their grand opening. The gentleman who showed us to our room told us that they will have their grand opening at the end of April. They are still doing some finishing touches on the pool and in one of the restaurants. The staff is very happy to assist you whatever you wish. Everyone we've spoken to speaks good English, so communication isn't a problem if English your primary language. The hotel itself is brand spanking new. Everything looks polished and smells new. We stayed in a room with 1 queen bed and had more than enough room for 2 average sized suit cases. Our room had a nice sized tv, a small sofa, lounging chair. I don't know about the double rooms, but in our room, there's a window that separates the bathroom and sleeping area. You can clearly see inside the bathroom from the bed. The bathroom itself is very nice looking. There is both a shower and a tub. The hotel is located about 30 minutes from the airport and just a few seconds from the University Station train station. The buffet breakfast in the main dining area is very good, but rather expensive. Expect to pay $450 HKD for two people.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay”
Reviews.Author: disalvo72
Reviews.Content: Recently open if you looking for a great place to stay not so far from all the major place in town with very good travel commodities, the MTR is just a 5 minutes walking distance and you can rich the center in 20-25 minutes. Great room, great food in the cafe and room service. Also very close is the horse racing stadium if you wanna try your luck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: GreenCheeze
Reviews.Content: Booked this via a travel agent because it was near our business stop. Pleasantly surprised to find a very new & stylish Hyatt with friendly but appropriately formal service. Bill came to $180 US for one night plus a breakfast charge, which seemed reasonable. Booked a standard room, but wonder if it was a Jr. Suite as it was quite large. It was very clean & had modern decor. Nice gym with new equipment (incluing new loaner shoes I borrowed). As it's brand new (trip was March 2009), they were still getting some kinks out (like fuzzy TV reception, possibly too-hot sauna, pool not yet in use, not all restaurants open, construction still going on next door, guest room doors slam hard, etc.) However, I'd still stay there again. Location is not ideal to see Hong Kong proper, but the Train stop is right near the hotel, and we went into Hong Kong one afternoon/evening very easliy.

Reviews.Title: “brand new”
Reviews.Author: restleswanderer
Reviews.Content: great hotel within reasonable distance of airport. rooms were fabulous and service excellent. Conceiage went above and beyond to help make stay great. Buffet dinner was also very good and service again excellent. The rooms have great design with glass showers and tubs. WOW
